member.name: T:Mergecom.Dicomdir.DirRecordType

member.summary: Real World Value Mapping record type.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCattributeSet
member.summary: Provides base functionality to control a collection of DICOM attributes.
member.remarks: Five subclasses are provided that represent different types of DICOM attribute collections:

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.syncAttribute(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Triggers the immediate propagation of the value(s) of an attribute to the underlying native layer, allowing associated managed resources to be freed sooner.
member.param: The tag of the attribute.
member.remarks: Especially useful for bulk attributes such as pixel data.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet._syncAttribute(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Method created to replace syncAttribute() and avoid the "obsolete" warning in syncPixelData
member.param: The tag of the attribute.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.syncPixelData
member.summary: Triggers the immediate propagation of the value of the pixel data attribute to the underlying native layer, allowing associated managed resources to be freed sooner.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.add(Mergecom.MCtag)
member.summary: Adds an empty attribute to this attribute set.
member.param: The tag identifying the attribute to add.
member.returns: The newly created attribute or if an attribute with the specified tag already exists in this attribute set, the existing attribute is returned.
member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.
The attribute tag is not valid for this attribute set.
The tag is not a standard DICOM tag.

member.summary: Adds an empty standard attribute to this attribute set.

member.returns: The newly created attribute or if an attribute with the specified tag already exists in this attribute set, the existing attribute is returned.
member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.

The tag is not a standard DICOM tag.

The value to set.
member.remarks: If the attribute to set does not exits in this set it is created first.
member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.removeAttribute(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes a standard attribute from this attribute set.
member.param: The tag of the attribute to remove.
member.remarks: Removing a bulk attribute from an attribute set causes the attribute to loose its value. This is because bulk attribute values are stored in unmanaged memory by the native toolkit's message object and removing the attribute from the message causes the value to be freed.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.removeAttribute(Mergecom.MCtag)
member.summary: Removes an attribute from this attribute set.
member.param: The tag of the attribute to remove.
member.remarks: Removing a bulk attribute from an attribute set causes the attribute to loose its value. This is because bulk attribute values are stored in unmanaged memory by the native toolkit's message object and removing the attribute from the message causes the value to be freed.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.streamIn(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCtransferSyntax,Mergecom.MCdataSource)
member.summary: Requests the contents of a "streamed message" (i.e. a message in the form defined by the DICOM standard) be converted and placed in this attribute set.
member.param: The tag number of the first attribute to decode.
The tag number of the last attribute to decode.
The transfer syntax of the stream.
An that provides access to the stream data.
member.returns: The byte offset in the stream where the decoding stopped.

remarks.para: Any attributes in the stream with tags less than or greater than will be ignored. Neither nor need to be in the stream.

If the stream contains any attributes with a value representation of SQ (i.e. the stream contains one or more sequences of items), an object is automatically created for each item in the stream. An object is used as the value for each item in each sequence attribute.

member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.

A tag was found in the stream that was not in ascending order or an invalid DICOM tag was detected in the stream or the stream ended without passing the entire value for an attribute or too many private blocks were encountered in the stream.
The stream returned an exception. See the inner exception for details.
Uneven data size returned by the stream.
One of the arguments was invalid.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.streamIn(Mergecom.MCtransferSyntax,Mergecom.MCdataSource)
member.summary: Requests the contents of a "streamed message" (i.e. a message in the form defined by the DICOM standard) be converted and placed in this attribute set.
member.param: The transfer syntax of the stream.
An that provides access to the stream data.
member.returns: The byte offset in the stream where the decoding stopped.

remarks.para: All attributes within the stream are to be placed into this attribute list.

If the stream contains any attributes with a value representation of SQ (i.e. the stream contains one or more sequences of items), an object is automatically created for each item in the stream. An object is used as the value for each item in each sequence attribute.

member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.

A tag was found in the stream that was not in ascending order or an invalid DICOM tag was detected in the stream or the stream ended without passing the entire value for an attribute or too many private blocks were encountered in the stream.
The stream returned an exception. See the inner exception for details.
Uneven data size returned by the stream.
One of the arguments was invalid.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.streamOut(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCtransferSyntax,Mergecom.MCdataSink)
member.summary: Requests that the contents of the attribute set be "streamed" (i.e. put in the form defined by the DICOM standard).
member.param: The tag number of the first attribute to be streamed.
The tag number of the last attribute to be streamed.
The transfer syntax for the output stream.
The destination for the output stream.

remarks.para: The streamed message is passed to the destination stream in blocks by calling MCdataSink.receiveData until the entire message has been transferred.

and specify which attributes in the attribute set are to be placed in the stream. Any attributes in the message with tags less than or greater than will be ignored. Neither nor need to be in the message.

The transfer syntax specifies the byte order used in the streamed message, whether or not each attribute's value representation is explicitly encoded in the stream, and how the pixel data is encoded in the message.

member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.
One of the arguments was invalid.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
The stream returned an exception. See the inner exception for details.
An attribute had an invalid value.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.streamOut(Mergecom.MCtransferSyntax,Mergecom.MCdataSink)
member.summary: Requests that the contents of the attributes set be "streamed" (i.e. put in the form defined by the DICOM standard).
member.param: The transfer syntax for the output stream.
The destination for the output stream.

remarks.para: All attributes within this attribute set will be placed in the stream.
The streamed message is passed to the destination stream in blocks by calling MCdataSink.receiveData until the entire message has been transferred.

The transfer syntax specifies the byte order used in the streamed message, whether or not each attribute's value representation is explicitly encoded in the stream, and how the pixel data is encoded in the message.

member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.
One of the arguments was invalid.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
The stream returned an exception. See the inner exception for details.
An attribute had an invalid value.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.copyTo(Mergecom.MCattributeSet)
member.summary: Copies the attributes within this set to another attribute set.
member.param: The attribute set to to copy this attribute set into.
member.remarks: This method utilizes the MCattribute.clone method to copy the attributes to . A copy is made of all attributes except the bulk data (OB, OW, OL, OD, OF tags) for which the data is shared.
member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.
An attribute being copied is not valid for the destination attribute set.

member.summary: Compares another MCattributeSet instance to this one.
member.param: The MCattributeSet to compare with this one.
member.returns: A String describing the first difference between the attribute sets or null if the two attribute sets contain the same data.
member.remarks: This method compares each attribute within the two attribute sets using method.
member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.

Starting tag number to compare
Stop tag number to compare
Tag numbers to skip
member.returns: A String describing the first difference between the attribute sets or null if the two attribute sets contain the same data.
member.remarks: This method compares each attribute within the two attribute sets using method.
member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.

member.summary: Determines if this attribute set is equal to another object.

member.returns: true if the object is an MCattributeSet instance and it contains the same data as the current attribute set.
member.remarks: Two attribute sets are considered equal if method returns null.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.Item(System.UInt32)
member.overloads: Gets or sets attributes or attribute values of this attribute set. In C#, this property is the indexer for the MCattributeSet class.
member.summary: Gets or sets a non-private attribute of this attribute set.
member.param: The tag number of the attribute to get or set.
member.value: The object with the specified tag.

remarks.para: When setting this property, if the specified attribute already exists, the attribute is replaced. If the assigned value is null this call is equivalent to a removeAttribute() call.
When getting this property, if the requested attribute does not exists, an exception is thrown.

member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.
The attribute tag is not valid for this attribute set.
The attribute was not in the attribute set.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCattributeSet.Item(Mergecom.MCtag)
member.summary: Gets or sets an attribute of this attribute set.
member.param: The tag of the attribute to get or set.
member.value: The object with the specified tag.

remarks.para: When setting this property, if the specified attribute already exists, the attribute is replaced. If the assigned value is null this call is equivalent to a removeAttribute() call.
When getting this property, if the requested attribute does not exists, an exception is thrown.

member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.
The attribute tag is not valid for this attribute set.
The attribute was not in the attribute set.

members.member:
Gets or sets attribute values of this attribute set.
The tag number of the attribute. The zero based index of the value to get or set. An object representing the value requested.
When setting this property, if the attribute with the specified tag does not exists, an new one is added. Setting this property is equivalent with the following call:
myAttributeSet.add(tag)[index]
When getting this property, if the requested attribute does not exists, an exception is thrown. If a value with the specified index does not exist null is returned.
The attribute set has been disposed. The tag is not in the attribute set. The VR of the attribute is OB, OW, OL, OD or OF.
When setting this property, the type of the value specified is incompatible with the VR of the attribute.
When setting this property, the value contains invalid characters for the VR of the attribute. When getting this attribute, is not a valid value for the attribute."

Gets or sets attribute values of this attribute set.
The tag of the attribute. The zero based index of the value to get or set. An object representing the value requested.
When setting this property, if the attribute with the specified tag does not exists, an new one is added. Setting this property is equivalent with the following call:
myAttributeSet.add(tag)[index]
When getting this property, if the requested attribute does not exists, an exception is thrown. If a value with the specified index does not exist null is returned.
The attribute set has been disposed. The tag is not in the attribute set. The VR of the attribute is OB, OW, OL, OD or OF.
When setting this property, the type of the value specified is incompatible with the VR of the attribute.
When setting this property, the value contains invalid characters for the VR of the attribute. When getting this attribute, is not a valid value for the attribute."

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates the root record of a directory.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.dispose
member.summary: Disposes this record and its associated native resources.
member.remarks: This method releases the resources allocated for this record but it does not delete the record from the DICOMDIR file. Subsequent navigation to the record represented by this object will cause the toolkit to reload the content of the record from the file and create a new record object for it.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.traverse(Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.RecordHandler)
member.summary: Provides easy record traversal and search functionality.
member.param: A delegate to be called for each record traversed.

remarks.para: This method traverses all directory records that are below this directory record, or all records if this record is the root record.

The toolkit makes a depth-first traversal of the record hierarchy calling the record handler delegate for each record. The application can control the traversal through the return value of the delegate.

member.exception: The record handler argument was null.
The record has been disposed.
A file read operation failed.
There was a problem decoding the DICOMDIR file. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
There is a problem with the structure of the DICOMDIR file.
The library has not been properly initialized.
An unexpected, potentially serious, problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.copyValues(Mergecom.MCattributeSet,System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Copies attribute values from the specified attribute set into this record.
member.param: The attribute set to copy values from.
The list of tag numbers of the attributes to be copied. If a tag is a group length tag, the attributes in the whole group are copied. If this parameter is null, all attributes are copied.
member.remarks: This method can be used to fill in directory record values from messages when adding instances to a file set.
member.exception: The source was null.
The record has been disposed.
The library has not been properly initialized.
An unexpected, potentially serious, problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.addRecord(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new lower level directory record to this record.
member.param: The directory record type name for the new record or the SOP Class UID of the referenced instance. If this argument is null the toolkit will set the record type based on the type of this record: "PATIENT" for root record, "STUDY" if the parent is "PATIENT", "SERIES" if the parent is "STUDY" and "IMAGE" if the parent is "SERIES". The application can change the record type on the returned record object before calling .
member.returns: The new directory record object.

remarks.para: This method creates a new directory record object and appends it to the end of the child record list of this record or to the end of the root entity if this record is the root record.

If the type of the record is not specified the toolkit will try to determine it based on the type of the parent record. For instance level records, the application can specify the SOP Class UID of the referenced object in the argument and the toolkit will determine the corresponding record type.

The new record and any values set for its attributes are written to the DICOMDIR file when the application calls MCdicomDir.update. If the directory object is closed without calling MCdicomDir.update, changes to the record hierarchy will be lost.

An unexpected, potentially serious, problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.delete

remarks.para: This method removes this directory record and any lower level record from the record hierarchy.
The changes made by this method are not reflected in the DICOMDIR file until the application calls on the DICOM directory object.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.TraversalStatus
member.summary: Enum for controlling directory record traversal when using the method.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.TraversalStatus.Continue
member.summary: The traversal continues normally with the lower level records of the current record or with the next record if the current record does not have lower level records.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.TraversalStatus.StopLevel
member.summary: The traversal continues with the next record of the current record's parent, skipping all lower level records and next records of the current record.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDirRecord.TraversalStatus.StopLower
member.summary: The traversal continues with the next record of the current record, skipping the current record's lower level records.

member.param: The record currently being visited.
member.returns: The status indicating how the traversal should continue.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Gen.MCstudyComponentManagementGet
member.summary: This class serves as a container for attributes of the STUDY_COMPONENT_MANAGEMENT IOD.
member.remarks:
The following DICOM attributes are maintained in this collection:
(00080005) Specific Character Set
(00080020) Study Date
(00080030) Study Time
(00080050) Accession Number
(00080060) Modality
(00081030) Study Description
(00081032) Procedure Code Sequence
(00081050) Performing Physician's Name
(00081060) Name of Physician(s) Reading Study
(00081100) Referenced Results Sequence
(00081110) Referenced Study Sequence
(00081111) Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
(00081115) Referenced Series Sequence
(00081120) Referenced Patient Sequence
(00081125) Referenced Visit Sequence
(0020000D) Study Instance UID
(00200010) Study ID
(00201000) Series in Study
(00201004) Acquisitions in Study
(00201070) Other Study Numbers
(0032000A) Study Status ID
(0032000C) Study Priority ID
(00320012) Study ID Issuer
(00320032) Study Verified Date
(00320033) Study Verified Time
(00320034) Study Read Date
(00320035) Study Read Time
(00321000) Scheduled Study Start Date
(00321001) Scheduled Study Start Time
(00321010) Scheduled Study Stop Date
(00321011) Scheduled Study Stop Time
(00321020) Scheduled Study Location
(00321021) Scheduled Study Location AE Title(s)
(00321030) Reason for Study
(00321032) Requesting Physician
(00321033) Requesting Service
(00321040) Study Arrival Date
(00321041) Study Arrival Time
(00321050) Study Completion Date
(00321055) Study Component Status ID
(00321060) Requested Procedure Description
(00321064) Requested Procedure Code Sequence
(00321070) Requested Contrast Agent
(00324000) Study Comments

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCabstractMessage
member.summary: Represents a common base class for and .

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCabstractMessage.duplicate(Mergecom.MCtransferSyntax,Mergecom.MCcompression,Mergecom.MCcompression)
member.summary: Creates a duplicate copy of a message or a file in the transfer syntax specified by .

remarks.para: This method is the primary method for compressing or decompressing objects with the Merge DICOM toolkit. This method can convert between different compressed transfer syntaxes, it can be used to compress an uncompressed message, or it can be used to decompress a compressed message.

When compressing an uncompressed MCabstractMessage instance, the parameter should be set to null and the parameter should be set to an instance that can compress the image in the transfer syntax specified by .

Similarly, when decompressing an MCabstractMessage instance, the parameter should be set to null and the parameter should be set to an instance that can decompress the image in the transfer syntax specified by .
Finally, when converting between compressed transfer syntaxes, an appropriate compressor and decompressor must be specified.

member.param: The transfer syntax of the newly created message or file object.
If is a compressed transfer syntax, a compressor must be supplied in this parameter.
If the message is encoded in a compressed transfer syntax, a decompressor must be supplied in this parameter.
member.returns: A newly created or object.
member.exception: The compressor or decompressor returned an error when duplicating.
The MCabstractMessage instance is not of type or .
A compressor or decompressor was required to complete the operation and was not specified.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCabstractMessage.registerCompression(Mergecom.MCcompression,Mergecom.MCcompression)
member.summary: Register compression callbacks for future use of compression/decompression operation
member.param: Default compressor
Default decompressor
member.exception: The compressor or decompressor returned an error when duplicating.
A compressor or decompressor was required to complete the operation and was not specified.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCabstractMessage.validate(Mergecom.MCvalidationLevel)
member.summary: Checks whether this message meets the DICOM validation criteria.
member.param: The requested level of validation.
member.returns: true if the message is valid, otherwise false.

remarks.para: This method validates the current message to determine that required attributes are present and that all attribute values are valid. The message is validated to insure that it meets the requirements of the specified service and command.

While the validation is quite comprehensive there are limitations in validating files:
If the attribute was specified by DICOM Part 3 as being in either a user optional module, or a conditional module, it will always be treated as a Type 3 attribute (optional attribute).
The Ultrasound Image Object used in storage services has mutually exclusive Image, Overlay, and Curve information entities. The attributes defined in these entities are all treated as Type 3 (optional attributes).
This method does not validate properly for application profiles that modify the standard content of a message.

In any case, this method is a powerful tool that can catch almost all problems with a message. The DICOM Standard should always be the final word on whether or not a message satisfies the DICOM protocol.

If the file is not valid, a list of validation violations is created that can be retrieved using getNextValidationError() method. Also, the results of the validation are logged into the message log (usually merge.log) at the T5_MESSAGE level.

member.exception: The message has been disposed.
An error occurred involving the message info file. The exact error is logged in the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCabstractMessage.validateAttribute(System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCvalidationLevel)
member.summary: Validates an attribute in this message's data set.
member.param: Identifies the attribute to validate.
The requested level of validation.
member.returns: true if the attribute value is valid, otherwise false.
member.remarks: See MCdataSet.validateAttribute for more details.
member.exception: The message has been disposed.
An error occurred involving the message info file. The exact error is logged in the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCabstractMessage.getNextValidationError
member.summary: Gets validation error information created by the validate() method.

member.exception: The message has been disposed.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCbasicCodedEntry.CodeValue
member.summary: The Code Value (0008,0100) is an identifier that is unambiguous within the Coding Scheme denoted by Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) and Coding Scheme Version (0008,0103). Note: The Code Value is typically not a natural language string, e.g. "T-04000".

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCbasicCodedEntry.CodingSchemeDesignator
member.summary: The attribute Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) identifies the coding scheme in which the code for a term is defined. Standard coding scheme designators used in DICOM information interchange are listed in PS 3.16. Other coding scheme designators, for both private and public coding schemes, may be used.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCbasicCodedEntry.CodingSchemeVersion
member.summary: The attribute Coding Scheme Version (0008,0103) may be used to identify the version of a coding scheme if necessary to resolve ambiguity in the Code Value (0008,0100) or Code Meaning (0008,0104). Coding Scheme Version (0008,0103) is not required for backward-compatible revisions of a coding scheme, as the Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) identifies the coding scheme as a whole as currently published by the responsible organization.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCbasicCodedEntry.CodeMeaning
member.summary: The Code Meaning (0008,0104) is text which has meaning to a human and which conveys the meaning of the term defined by the combination of Code Value and Coding Scheme Designator. Though such a meaning can be "looked up" in the dictionary for the coding scheme, it is encoded for the convenience of applications that do not have access to such a dictionary.

member.summary: This method is the first method called when Merge DICOM .NET toolkit starts compressing data. It allows the implementing class to create a context object which can be used during compression and decompression to hold the state of the compression.
member.remarks: The method is called to release the context and potentially native resources associated with the compression.

The transfer syntax of the source data.
The transfer syntax of the destination data.
member.returns: The application defined context object.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCcompression.processData(System.Object,Mergecom.MCdata,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Data is passed to this method to be processed. When applicable, data is returned.

remarks.para: When decompressing, the property may be set if an offset table was created with the compressed data. If not, the decompression must determine when the end of data has been reached.

The routine also should set as appropriate if it has completed decompressing its data. Note also that DICOM .NET Toolkit will be looking at the amount of data returned from the function to determine if an entire frame of decompressed data has been returned.

member.param: The context returned by the method.
Input data to work on.
This parameter is set to true on the first call.
member.returns: Data that has been compressed or decompressed. If not enough data has been passed to the instance to generate output data, the method may return null.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDir
member.summary: Provides functionality to manipulate DICOMDIR files.

remarks.para: This class provides enhanced DICOMDIR functionality in contrast to the class with basic, in memory, DICOMDIR functionality.

MCdicomDir reads records from the DICOMDIR file only when they are required speeding up the access to specific records. This class also allows updates to existing DICOMDIR files without the need to rewrite the whole file when a directory record is added or deleted.

Instances of this class allow the application to incrementally add new records or delete existing records using the MCdicomDirRecord.addRecord, MCdicomDirRecord.delete and methods, without rewriting the whole file.

Attributes of the directory entity can be read through the root record object provided by the property. The Directory Record Sequence (0004,1220) attribute and its content is not accessible to the application as it is managed internally by the toolkit.

Although the toolkit allows the application to modify the content of existing directory records or the attributes in the directory object itself, the changes will not be reflected in the DICOMDIR file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDir.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class providing access to an existing DICOMDIR file.
member.param: The file path to the DICOMDIR file.

remarks.para: This constructor opens an existing DICOMDIR file for reading and/or updating.

As opposed to opening DICODMIR files using the class, this class does not read the whole content of the DICOMDIR in the memory, instead it reads only the first directory record if it exists. Subsequent directory records are read only on demand, when the application requires access to them, providing fast and efficient access to large DICOMDIRs.

member.exception: The path argument was invalid.
The toolkit failed to open the DICOMDIR file.
An invalid transfer syntax code was found within the file's DICOM File Meta Information.
There was a problem decoding the DICOMDIR file. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
The toolkit failed to read the first directory record.
The library has not been properly initialized.
An unexpected, potentially serious, problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDir.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Mergecom.MCfile)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class to handle a new DICOMDIR file.
member.param: The file path to the new DICOMDIR file.
The value to be assigned to the File Set ID attribute (0004,1130). If this argument is null the toolkit will copy the value of the File Set ID attribute from the template file, if specified
A file object containing attribute values for the new DICODMIR. If this argument is null the toolkit creates an empty DICOMDIR with a minimal number of attributes.
member.exception: The path argument was invalid.
The toolkit failed to write the DICOMDIR file.
The library has not been properly initialized.
An unexpected, potentially serious, problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

remarks.para: This constructor creates a DICOMDIR file with no records. If a file with the same name exist its content is overwritten.

The toolkit copies group 2 and 4 attribute values from the specified template file object. If the Media Storage SOP Instance UID attribute is not present in the template file or the template file argument is null the toolkit will generate a UID based on the IMPLEMENTATION_CLASS_UID configuration item.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDir.update
member.summary: Commits all pending changes to the DICOMDIR file.

remarks.para: This method updates the DICOMDIR file to reflect all changes to the dicomdir object as the result of adding and deleting records. The toolkit writes new records to the end of the directory record seqeunce and bridges over deleted records so that they are no longer accessible.
The toolkit does not make changes to existing records or the attributes of the directory object, except for the values of the offset attributes required to represent the modified record hierarchy.

member.exception: A failure occured while writing the file. The DICOMDIR file may be corrupted.

The DICOMDIR file could not be opened for writing or a file read or write operation failed. The DICOMDIR file is in a consistent state but the directory object can not be reliably used and it should be disposed using the method.
A directory record offset value is not correct and new records can not be written, the directory object can still be used in readonly mode.
The library has not been properly initialized.

An unexpected, potentially serious, problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge log file. The DICOMDIR file is in a consistent state but the directory object can not be reliably used and it should be freed using method.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDir.close
member.summary: Closes the DICOMDIR file and releases all record objects associated with it.
member.remarks: This method ignores any changes made to the record hierarchy (new or deleted records) since the last call to method.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Dicomdir.MCdicomDir.RootRecord
member.summary: Gets the record object representing the root of the directory record hierarchy.
member.value: The record object representing the root entity of the directory.

remarks.para: The Root record does not represent a physical record in the DICOMDIR file, instead it provides access to attributes of the directory object and it allows consistent navigation throughout the record hierarchy.

member.exception: The DICOMDIR object has been disposed.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCdigitalProfile
member.summary: Defines Signature Profile with a mechanism for adding Digital Signatures (DICOM PS 3.15, C Digital Signature Profiles)

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCdigitalProfile.BaseRSA
member.summary: Outlines the use of RSA encryption of a MAC to generate a Digital Signature. The creator of a digital signature shall use one of the RIPEMD-160, MD5, SHA-1 or SHA-2 family (SHA256, SHA384, SHA512) of hashing functions to generate a MAC, which is then encrypted using a private RSA key.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCdigitalProfile.CreatorRSA
member.summary: The creator of a DICOM SOP Instance may generate signatures using the Creator RSA Digital Signature Profile. The Digital Signature produced by this Profile serves as a lifetime data integrity check that can be used to verify that the pixel data in the SOP instance has not been altered since its initial creation.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCdigitalProfile.AuthorizationRSA
member.summary: The technician or physician who approves a DICOM SOP Instance for use may request the Application Entity to generate a signature using the Authorization RSA Digital Signature Profile. The Digital Signature produced serves as a lifetime data integrity check that can be used to verify that the pixel data in the SOP instance is the same that the technician or physician saw when they made the approval.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCdigitalProfile.StructureReportRSA
member.summary: The profile defines a mechanism for adding Digital Signatures to Structured Reports or Key Object Selection Documents where there is no more than one Verifying Observer.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCdigitalSignature
member.summary: Creates, adds, removes and verifies Digital Signatures (DICOM PS 3.3, C.12.1.1.3 Digital Signatures Macro) in object

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCitems
member.summary:
MCitems structure contains constant strings representing names for the DICOM sequence items as defined in the mergecom.srv configuration file. It eliminates the need to hard code these names and makes possible compile time checking.
As the standard evolves the structure will be updated in order to remain current. In particular, the following changes can be expected:
New fields will be added as new sequence item types are defined in new Supplements and Change Proposals.
member.remarks: For item names starting with a digit, a '_' character will be prepended to the field name. Other characters such as '.' or '-' (illegal in C# identifiers) will be replaced with '_'.

member.summary: Sends a Response message with a status of 0x0107.
member.remarks: This response is used when one or more attribute values were not read because the specified attribute was not recognized. The attribute values that could be read are returned, however.
member.param: The DIMSE message being responded to.
A data set containing attribute values that could be read, or null if the attributes that could be read should not be included in the response.

member.exception: The operation is not allowed in the current context.
The association was aborted.
The current service does not support this message.
One of the arguments was invalid.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseService.sendCancelledResponse(Mergecom.MCdimseMessage)
member.summary: Sends a Response message with a status of 0xFE00.

remarks.para: This method sends a response message indicating that a C-CANCEL request was received for the C-FIND, C-GET or C_MOVE operation contained in requestMsg.
The first form of the call is used for C-FIND operations and for C-GET or C-MOVE operations that have experienced no failures and that will not supply any sub-operation counters.

The second and third forms of the call may only be used when responding to a C-GET or a C-MOVE request. Each of the last four arguments are optional and may be null. If not null, remainingSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1020), completedSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1021), failedSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1022), and warningSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1023).

The third form of the call must be used when responding to a C-GET or a C-MOVE request when the C-STORE sub-operation for one or more SOP instances failed. In that case, the identifier must contain the Failed SOP Instance UID List (0008,0048) attribute that specifies a list of UIDs of the C-STORE sub-operation SOP Instances for which the C-GET or C-MOVE operation has failed. If there were no sub-operation failures, there is no need for an identifier data set.
The status attribute (0000,0900) will be set to 0xFE00 (cancelled).

member.param: The request message being responded to.
member.exception: This method was called at an inappropriate time. This would be thrown, for example, if this method were called when there is no response message pending for specified message.
The association was aborted. No further calls may be made for the association.
The service associated with the specified message is not one that was negotiated for the association, or it was never set.
The command associated with the message was invalid.

The first form of the call is used for C-FIND operations and for C-GET or C-MOVE operations that have experienced no failures and that will not supply any sub-operation counters.

The second and third forms of the call may only be used when responding to a C-GET or a C-MOVE request. Each of the last four arguments are optional and may be null. If not null, remainingSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1020), completedSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1021), failedSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1022), and warningSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1023).

The third form of the call must be used when responding to a C-GET or a C-MOVE request when the C-STORE sub-operation for one or more SOP instances failed. In that case, the identifier must contain the Failed SOP Instance UID List (0008,0048) attribute that specifies a list of UIDs of the C-STORE sub-operation SOP Instances for which the C-GET or C-MOVE operation has failed. member.param: The request message being responded to.

Remaining sub-operation count.

Warning sub-operation count.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseService.sendRequestMessage(Mergecom.MCdimseMessage)
member.summary: Sends a DIMSE request message to the association partner.

remarks.para: This method sends a request message to the remote application. The message must have its service and command set, and the msg command must be a valid DIMSE request command. The message will be sent across the association declared when this was constructed.
NOTE: This method (and the method) are normally used by advanced users. Sub-classes of this class provide send message commands that enforce the rules of specific DICOM service classes.

NOTE: Some DICOM services require that values for certain command set attributes (i.e. group 0 attributes) be set. The Merge DICOM toolkit automatically adds command set attributes when an is constructed. With the exceptions listed below, you must set any command set attribute values before sending the message. However, this method will set the following attribute values for you if you have not set them:

list.item: The group length attribute (0000,0000) value is always set by the Merge DICOM toolkit.
If the message command requires it, the Affected SOP Class UID attribute (0000,0002) value is set to the service's abstract syntax UID.
The command attribute (0000,0100) value is always set by the Merge DICOM toolkit.
The Message ID attribute (0000,0110) value is set to a unique number for this association.
If the message command requires it, the Priority attribute (0000,0700) value is set to "medium" priority (i.e. zero).
The Data Set Type attribute (0000,0800) value is always set by the Merge DICOM toolkit.

remarks.para: The affectedSopInstanceUID parameter for some variations of this method is optional. If it is null or if it is an empty string, it will be ignored. Not all DICOM services require this attribute. If it is specified, it will be encoded in the message's command set in attribute (0000,1000).

The metaServiceName parameter included in some variations to this method is also optional. If it is null or it if is an empty string, it will be ignored. Some DICOM services (e.g. the Basic Print Service) allow you to support multiple meta services. Each meta service consists of a set of basic DICOM services. In some cases a DICOM application may support multiple meta services over the same association. When two of the meta services include the same basic service, this metaServiceName parameter is used to tell the Merge DICOM toolkit which meta service to use when sending the message.

member.param: The message to be sent.
member.exception: This method was called at an inappropriate time. This would be thrown, for example, if this method were called by an association acceptor before calling the accept method of the MCassociation object associated with this service.
The service associated with message is not one that was negotiated for the association, or it was never set.
The association was aborted. No further calls may be made for the association.
The Affected SOP Instance UID is required by the service and was not supplied by affectedSopInstanceUID and it was not already in the message's command set.
Sending this request message will cause the maximum operations negotiated to be exceeded.
The message argument was null.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseService.sendResponse(Mergecom.MCstatusInfo)
member.summary: Sends a Response message with a given status code.

remarks.para: It is the caller's responsibility to insure that all required attributes are provided in the MCstatusInfo container. If a required attribute is missing, an IllegalStatusException will be thrown. Note that info.requestMsg and info.statusCode must be set to valid values.
If any of the MCstatusInfo fields are not null, they will be used to set the appropriate message attribute.

The service and command must have been set in the request message: The response message command is set to the request message command or'd with 0x8000. The response message service is set to the request message service.

member.param: Container for optional response fields.
member.exception: This method was called at an inappropriate time. This would be thrown, for example, if this method were called when there is no response message pending.
The association was aborted. No further calls may be made for the association.
The service associated with is not one that was negotiated for the association, or it was never set.
The command associated with the message was invalid.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseService.sendResponseMessage(Mergecom.MCdimseMessage,Mergecom.MCdimseMessage,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Allows the caller to respond to a message received from the remote application.

remarks.para: This method is called after a successful call.
NOTE: This method (and the method) are normally used by advanced users. Sub-classes of this class provide send message commands that enforce the rules of specific DICOM service classes.

statusCode provides the status of the requested operation and must be a valid response code for the service involved. Response codes are defined in the class. Many DICOM services do not require a response of more than just a status. Others, however, (e.g. C_FIND_RSP) require the setting of several message attributes.

responseMsg, if provided, must have been constructed for the same service as the requestMsg, and for an appropriate command. For example, if responding to a C-STORE request message, the responseMsg would be constructed as follows:
If responseMsg is not provided, the Merge DICOM toolkit will construct one for you.

NOTE: Some DICOM services require that values for certain command set attributes (i.e. group 0 attributes) be set. The Merge DICOM toolkit automatically adds command set attributes when an is constructed. With the exceptions listed below, you must set any command set attribute values before sending the message. However, this method will set the following attribute values for you if you have not set them:

list.item: The group length attribute (0000,0000) value is always set by the Merge DICOM toolkit.
If the message command requires it, the Affected SOP Class UID attribute (0000,0002) value is set to the service's abstract syntax UID.
The command attribute (0000,0100) value is always set by the Merge DICOM toolkit.
The Response Message ID attribute (0000,0120) value is set to the message ID of the last received Request message for this association.
The Data Set Type attribute (0000,0800) value is always set by the Merge DICOM toolkit.

member.param: The request message being responded to.
The response message
The status code for the response.
member.exception: This method was called at an inappropriate time. This would be thrown, for example, if this method were called when there is no response message pending for .
The association was aborted. No further calls may be made for the association.
The service associated with is not one that was negotiated for the association, or it was never set.
The command associated with the message was invalid or one of the messages was null.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseService.sendResponseMessage(System.String,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Allows the caller to respond to a message received from the remote application.

remarks.para: This method is called after a successful call.
NOTE: This method (and the method) are normally used by advanced users. Sub-classes of this class provide send message commands that enforce the rules of specific DICOM service classes.

statusCode provides the status of the requested operation and must be a valid response code for the service involved. Response codes are defined in the class. Many DICOM services do not require a response of more than just a status. Others, however, (e.g. C_FIND_RSP) require the setting of several message attributes.

responseMsg, if provided, must have been constructed for the same service as the requestMsg, and for an appropriate command. For example, if responding to a C-STORE request message, the responseMsg would be constructed as follows:
If responseMsg is not provided, the Merge DICOM toolkit will construct one for you.

NOTE: Some DICOM services require that values for certain command set attributes (i.e. group 0 attributes) be set. The Merge DICOM toolkit automatically adds command set attributes when an is constructed. With the exceptions listed below, you must set any command set attribute values before sending the message. However, this method will set the following attribute values for you if you have not set them:

list.item: The group length attribute (0000,0000) value is always set by the Merge DICOM toolkit.
If the message command requires it, the Affected SOP Class UID attribute (0000,0002) value is set to the service's abstract syntax UID.
The command attribute (0000,0100) value is always set by the Merge DICOM toolkit.
The Response Message ID attribute (0000,0120) value is set to the message ID of the last received Request message for this association.
The Data Set Type attribute (0000,0800) value is always set by the Merge DICOM toolkit.

member.param: The service name of the request message
The command of the request message
The status code for the response.
member.exception: This method was called at an inappropriate time. This would be thrown, for example, if this method were called when there is no response message pending for the request message.
The association was aborted. No further calls may be made for the association.
The is not one that was negotiated for the association, or is null.
The command associated with the message was invalid

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCcontainerItem.TemplateId
member.summary: Identifies the Template that was used in the creation of the associated Content Item and its subsidiary Content Items. A Template is identified by a Mapping Resource (0008,0105) (the entity that manages or registers the Template), and an identifier of the Template. DICOM Standard Templates are identified in Template Identifier (0040,DB00) using the CS value representation. The DICOM Template identifier (0040,DB00) is a string of digits, without leading zeroes, and does not include the string "TID".

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCcontainerItem.ContinuityOfContent
member.summary: Continuity of Content (0040,A050) specifies whether or not all the Content Items contained in a CONTAINER are logically linked in a continuous textual flow, or are separate entities. It only applies to the children contained in the container, and not their children (which if containers themselves, will have the attribute specified explicitly).

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCcontainerItem.Continuity
member.summary: Specifies for a CONTAINER whether or not its contained Content Items are logically linked in a continuous textual flow, or are separate items.

member.summary: Content Items are logically linked in a continuous textual flow

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCimageItem.ReferencedFrames
member.summary: Identifies the frame numbers within the Referenced SOP Instance to which the reference applies. The first frame shall be denoted as frame number 1. Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a multi-frame image and the reference does not apply to all frames, and Referenced Segment Number (0062,000B) is not present.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCimageItem.ReferencedSegments
member.summary: Identifies the segments to which the reference applies identified by Segment Number (0062,0004). Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Segmentation and the reference does not apply to all segments and Referenced Frame Number (0008,1160) is not present.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCimageItem.ReferencedSps
member.summary: Optional reference to a Softcopy Presentation State SOP Class/SOP Instance pair.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCimageItem.ReferencedRealWorldVm
member.summary: Optional reference to a Real World Value Mapping SOP Class/SOP Instance pair.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCitemIdentifer
member.summary: Represents the Content Item position An ordered set of one or more integers that uniquely identifies the Target Content Item of the relationship. The root Content Item is referenced by a single value of 1. Each subsequent integer represents an ordinal position of a Content Item in the Content Sequence (0040,A730) in which it belongs. The number of values in this Multi-Value Attribute is exactly the number of relationships traversed in the SR content tree plus one.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCrelationshipType
member.summary: The type of relationship between the (enclosing) Source Content Item and the Target Content Item.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCrelationshipType.CONTAINS
F:Mergecom.Sr.MCrelationshipType.HAS_OBS_CONTEXT
member.summary: Target Content Items shall convey any specialization of Observation Context needed for unambiguous documentation of the Source Content Item. E.g: CONTAINER: "Report" {HAS OBS CONTEXT: PNAME: "Recording Observer" = "Smith^John^^Dr^"}

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCrelationshipType.HAS_ACQ_CONTEXT
member.summary: The Target Content Item describes the conditions present during data acquisition of the Source Content Item. E.g: IMAGE 36 {HAS ACQ CONTEXT: CODE "contrast agent", HAS ACQ CONTEXT: CODE "position of imaging subject", ...}.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCrelationshipType.HAS_CONCEPT_MOD
F:Mergecom.Sr.MCrelationshipType.HAS_PROPERTIES
member.summary: Description of properties of the Source Content Item. E.g: CODE "Mass" {HAS PROPERTIES: CODE "anatomic location", HAS PROPERTIES: CODE "diameter", HAS PROPERTIES: CODE "margin", ...}.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCrelationshipType.INFERRED_FROM
member.summary: Source Content Item conveys a measurement or other inference made from the Target Content Items. Denotes the supporting evidence for a measurement or judgment. E.g: CODE "Malignancy" {INFERRED FROM: CODE "Mass", INFERRED FROM: CODE "Lymphadenopathy",...}. E.g: NUM: "BPD = 5mm" {INFERRED FROM: SCOORD}.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCrelationshipType.SELECTED_FROM
member.summary: Source Content Item conveys spatial or temporal coordinates selected from the Target Content Item(s). E.g: SCOORD: "CLOSED 1,1 5,10" {SELECTED FROM: IMAGE 36}. E.g: TCOORD: "SEGMENT 60-200mS" {SELECTED FROM: WAVEFORM}.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCrelationshipType.UNDEFINED
member.summary: The relationship is not defined yet. It is valid only if there is no parent

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem
member.summary: Spatial coordinates of a geometric region of interest in the DICOM image coordinate system. The IMAGE Content Item from which spatial coordinates are selected is denoted by a SELECTED FROM relationship Note: Spatial coordinates may be used to associate observational data with a set of Image features. Spatial coordinates also may be used to convey coordinates that are input data for a measurement.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.#ctor(System.String,Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicTypes,System.Collections.Generic.List{Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.Position})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the SCOORD3D Content Item
member.param: Uniquely identifies the Frame of Reference within which the coordinates are defined.
Defines the type of geometry of the annotated region of interest
An ordered set of (column,row) pairs that denote positions in an image

member.name: M:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.Read(Mergecom.MCattributeSet)
member.param: source DataSet

member.name: M:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.Write(Mergecom.MCattributeSet)
member.param: Destination DataSet

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.ReferencedUID
member.summary: Uniquely identifies the Frame of Reference within which the coordinates are defined.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicType
member.summary: When annotation applies to an image, this attribute defines the type of geometry of the annotated region of interest.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicData
member.summary: An ordered set of (column,row) pairs that denote positions in an image specified with sub-pixel resolution such that the origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is Columns\Rows. The values must be within the range 0\0 to Columns\Rows. The values Columns (0028,0011) and Rows (0028,0010) are those contained in the referenced image

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.ContentItemType
member.summary: Returns the content node type. Can be used for upcasting.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicTypes
member.summary: This attribute defines the type of geometry of the region of interest specified for 3D spatial coordinate geometries

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicTypes.POINT
member.summary: A single location denoted by a single (x,y,z) triplet.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicTypes.MULTIPOINT
member.summary: Multiple locations each denoted by an (x,y,z) triplet; the points need not be coplanar.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicTypes.POLYLINE
member.summary: A series of connected line segments with ordered vertices denoted by (x,y,z) triplets; the points need not be coplanar.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicTypes.POLYGON
member.summary: A series of connected line segments with ordered vertices denoted by (x,y,z) triplets, where the first and last vertices shall be the same forming a polygon; the points shall be coplanar.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicTypes.ELLIPSE
member.summary: An ellipse defined by four (x,y,z) triplets, the first two triplets specifying the endpoints of the major axis and the second two triplets specifying the endpoints of the minor axis.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.GraphicTypes.ELLIPSOID
member.summary: A three-dimensional geometric surface whose plane sections are either ellipses or circles and contains three intersecting orthogonal axes, "a", "b", and "c". The ellipsoid is defined by six (x,y,z) triplets, the first and second triplets specifying the endpoints of axis "a", the third and fourth triplets specifying the endpoints of axis "b", and the fifth and sixth triplets specifying the endpoints of axis "c".

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinates3DItem.Position
member.summary: An ordered set of (x,y,z) triplets (in mm and may be negative) that define a region of interest in the patient-relative Reference Coordinate System defined by Referenced Frame of Reference UID (3006,0024).

member.summary: Creates a new Position with data
member.param: X coordinate
Y coordinate
Z coordinate

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinatesItem.GraphicTypes
member.summary: When annotation applies to an image, this attribute defines the type of geometry of the annotated region of interest.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinatesItem.GraphicTypes.POINT
member.summary: a single pixel denoted by a single (column,row) pair

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinatesItem.GraphicTypes.MULTIPOINT
member.summary: multiple pixels each denoted by an (column,row) pair

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinatesItem.GraphicTypes.POLYLINE
member.summary: a series of connected line segments with ordered vertices denoted by (column,row) pairs; if the first and last vertices are the same it is a closed polygon

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinatesItem.GraphicTypes.CIRCLE
member.summary: a circle defined by two (column,row) pairs. The first point is the central pixel. The second point is a pixel on the perimeter of the circle.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinatesItem.GraphicTypes.ELLIPSE
member.summary: an ellipse defined by four pixel (column,row) pairs, the first two points specifying the endpoints of the major axis and the second two points specifying the endpoints of the minor axis of an ellipse

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCspatialCoordinatesItem.Position
member.summary: A column and row pair that denote position in an image specified with sub-pixel resolution such that the origin at the TLHC of the TLHC pixel is 0.0\0.0, the BRHC of the TLHC pixel is 1.0\1.0, and the BRHC of the BRHC pixel is Columns\Rows. The values must be within the range 0\0 to Columns\Rows. The values Columns (0028,0011) and Rows (0028,0010) are those contained in the referenced image.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCstructuredReport
member.summary: Represents the SR Document Content Module and supports following contents - Basic Text SR IOD Content - Enhanced SR IOD Content - Comprehensive SR IOD Content

member.name: M:Mergecom.Sr.MCstructuredReport.#ctor(System.String,Mergecom.Sr.MCcontainerItem.Continuity,Mergecom.MCbasicCodedEntry)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the structured report and initializes the root CONTAINER item
member.param: The DICOM Template identifier (0040,DB00) is a string of digits, without leading zeroes, and does not include the string "TID".
specifies whether or not all the Content Items contained in a CONTAINER are logically linked in a continuous textual flow, or are separate entities
Document Title

member.name: M:Mergecom.Sr.MCstructuredReport.UpdateItemFactory(Mergecom.Sr.ContentItemType,System.Type)
member.summary:
This function allows to update the Content Item Class Factory with new extended classes The classes instances created automatically during reading the content tree and by default it always creates known classes as follows:
ContentItemType.TEXT MCtextItem ContentItemType.NUM MCnumItem ContentItemType.CODE MCcodeItem ContentItemType.DATE MCdateItem ContentItemType.TIME MCtimeItem ContentItemType.DATETIME MCdateTimeItem ContentItemType.UIDREF MCuidReferenceItem ContentItemType.PNAME MCpersonNameItem ContentItemType.COMPOSITE MCcompositeItem ContentItemType.IMAGE MCimageItem ContentItemType.WAVEFORM MCwaveformItem ContentItemType.SCOORD MCspatialCoordinatesItem ContentItemType.SCOORD3D MCspatialCoordinates3DItem ContentItemType.TCOORD_DATE MCtemporalCoordDateTimeItem ContentItemType.TCOORD_TIME MCtemporalCoordTimeOffsetsItem ContentItemType.TCOORD_POSITION MCtemporalCoordPositionsItem ContentItemType.CONTAINER MCcontainerItem ContentItemType.TABLE MCtableItem
Note: Factory map is local to the MCstructuredReport class instance and can be updated through this method. To make sure the default classes resuable, the new class type is defined to be the subclass of the default class type as shown in the tableabove. One special case is that there is no default specific class type for ContentItemType.UNKNOWN value type. By default MCillegalArgumentException will be thrown if it encounters any value type that is not defined by DICOM during the reading. However, the class type for the unkown value type can be specified here by the user to tolerate such kinds of illegal data instead of throwing an exception. Any class that is derived from MCcontentItem is acceptable for ContentItemType.UNKNOWN value type.
member.param: Content Item type to be updated
New class type to be used for that content. It shall be derived from the default class for that type
member.exception: Will be thrown if the new class is not derived from the original class used for that type

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableCellValues.TableColumnNumber
member.summary: The column, numbered from 1, of the table.
member.remarks: Represents the Table Column Number (0040,A805) attribute. Required if Table Row Number is absent, or all the columns for the row specified in Table Row Number are not encoded in a single Attribute (containing multiple values) in this Item (i.e., with a single VR).

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableCellValues.ReferencedContentItemIds
member.summary: An ordered set of one or more integers that uniquely identifies the Content Item that is the value for this cell.
member.remarks: Required if Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) is not present.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableCellValues.SelectorAttributeValues
member.summary: Numeric/DateTime/text/coded value(s) of the cell(s) in this Item

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableCellValues.MeasurementUnitsCode
member.summary: Units of measurement that apply to all the numeric values in this cell.

remarks.para: Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

Required if this cell is a numeric value (Selector Attribute VR is DS, FD, FL, IS, SL, SS, SV, UL, US or UV) has a unit (is not dimensionless), and the unit is not specified within the Table Row Definition Sequence for this row or Table Column Definition Sequence for this column.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableCellValues.NumericValueQualifierCode
member.summary: The reason for the absence of the numeric value.

remarks.para: Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.
Required if this cell is a numeric value (Selector Attribute VR is DS, FD, FL, IS, SL, SS, SV, UL, US or UV), and the numeric value cannot be provided.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem
member.summary: Table that represents the value of the Content Item.

remarks.para: Shall consist of a single Item whose Attributes convey the cell value(s), which represent rows and columns consisting of text, codes, integers, real numbers or DateTimes.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Mergecom.Sr.MCtableRowDefinition},System.Collections.Generic.List{Mergecom.Sr.MCtableColumnDefinition},System.Collections.Generic.List{Mergecom.Sr.MCtableCellValues},Mergecom.MCbasicCodedEntry)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the TABLE Content Item
member.param: The number of rows in this table
The number of columns in this table
The concepts that define the meaning of the rows of the table.
The concepts that define the meaning of the columns of the table.
The values of each populated cell in the table, identified by row and column.
Code describing the concept represented by this Content Item.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem.Read(Mergecom.MCattributeSet)
member.summary: Read the TABLE content item from an attribute set
member.param: The source attribute set

member.name: M:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem.Write(Mergecom.MCattributeSet)
member.summary: Write the TABLE content item to an attribute set
member.param: The destination attribute set

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem.TableRows
member.summary: The number of rows in this table. Represents the value of the Number of Table Rows (0040,A802) attribute.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem.TableColumns
member.summary: The number of columns in this table. Represents the value of the Number of Table Columns (0040,A803) attribute.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem.TableRowDefinitions
member.summary: List of the concepts that define the meaning of the rows of the table. Represents the value of the Table Row Definition Sequence (0040,A806) attribute.

remarks.para: One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
If a single Item is present, then the concept applies to all the rows.
Not all rows need to be described.
Items of this Sequence shall be sorted by Table Row Number.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem.TableColumnDefinitions
member.summary: List of the concepts that define the meaning of the columns of the table. Represents the value of the Table Column Definition Sequence (0040,A807) attribute.

remarks.para: One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
If a single Item is present, then the concept applies to all the columns.
Not all columns need to be described.
Items of this Sequence shall be sorted by Table Column Number.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem.TableCellValues
member.summary: List of the values of each populated cell in the table, identified by row and column. Represents the Cell Values Sequence (0040,A808) attribute.

remarks.para: One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
The table may be sparse (i.e., not every cell is required to be populated).
Entire rows may be specified in a single Item if all the columns have the same VR.
Entire columns may be specified in a single Item if all the rows have the same VR.
Items of this Sequence shall be in row-major order, then sorted by column.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtableItem.ContentItemType
member.summary: Returns the content node type. Can be used for upcasting.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCtemporalCoordDateTimeItem
member.summary: Represents a DICOM TCOORD content item specifying temporal points for reference by absolute time.
member.remarks: This type of content item has the Referenced DateTime attribute (0040, A13A) present.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCtemporalCoordinatesItem
member.summary: A base class for the Temporal Coordinates (i.e. time or eventbased coordinates) of a region of interest in the DICOM waveform coordinate system. The WAVEFORM or IMAGE or SCOORD Content Item from which Temporal Coordinates are selected is denoted by a SELECTED FROM relationship.

member.param: Destination DataSet

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtemporalCoordinatesItem.RangeType
member.summary: This Attribute defines the type of temporal extent of the region of interest. A temporal point (or instant of time) may be defined by a waveform sample offset (for a single waveform multiplex group only), time offset, or absolute time.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCtemporalCoordinatesItem.RangeTypeString
member.summary: Internal property wrapping the rangeType enum

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCtemporalCoordinatesItem.RangeTypes
member.summary: This Attribute defines the type of temporal extent of the region of interest. A temporal point (or instant of time) may be defined by a waveform sample offset (for a single waveform multiplex group only), time offset, or absolute time.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCtemporalCoordinatesItem.RangeTypes.SEGMENT
member.summary: a range between two temporal points

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCtemporalCoordinatesItem.RangeTypes.MULTISEGMENT
member.summary: multiple segments, each denoted by two temporal points

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCtemporalCoordinatesItem.RangeTypes.BEGIN
member.summary: a range beginning at one temporal point, and extending beyond the end of the acquired data

member.name: F:Mergecom.Sr.MCtemporalCoordinatesItem.RangeTypes.END
member.summary: a range beginning before the start of the acquired data, and extending to (and including) the identified temporal point

member.name: T:Mergecom.Sr.MCwaveformItem.Channel
member.summary:
Referenced Waveform Channel
Each channel is specified as a pair of values (M,C), where the first value is the sequence item number of the Waveform Sequence (5400,0100) attribute in the referenced object (i.e. the Multiplex Group Number), and the second value is the sequence item number of the Channel Definition Sequence (003A,0200) attribute (i.e., the Channel Number) within the multiplex group. If the specified channel number is 0, the annotation applies to all channels in the multiplex group.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Sr.MCwaveformItem.Channel.#ctor(System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Creates a new Waveform Channel reference
member.param: The sequence item number of the Waveform Sequence (5400,0100) attribute in the referenced object (i.e. the Multiplex Group Number).
The sequence item number of the Channel Definition Sequence (003A,0200) attribute (i.e., the Channel Number) within the multiplex group.

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCwaveformItem.Channel.MultiplexGroupNumber
member.summary: The sequence item number of the Waveform Sequence (5400,0100) attribute in the referenced object (i.e. the Multiplex Group Number).

member.name: P:Mergecom.Sr.MCwaveformItem.Channel.ChannelNumber
member.summary: The sequence item number of the Channel Definition Sequence (003A,0200) attribute (i.e., the Channel Number) within the multiplex group.

member.name: T:Mergecom.Logging.MClog
member.summary: Contains Logging functionality for the Merge DICOM toolkit library.

remarks.para: In normal operation, the log lines are written to a log file configured in the merge.ini file. It is also possible to register a log handler that will be called whenever a log line is generated. The log handler can then display this log if necessary in the user application.
The Merge DICOM toolkit library generates a number of different "message types". The following is a summary of the types:

list.item: Error messages have a message type of "E" and are used to convey a serious problem that has occurred.
Warning messages have a message type of "W" and are used to convey warning situations that could possibly be a problem.
Info messages have a message type of "I" and are simple informational type messages.
(T1): Internal tracing.
(T2): Network messages received or sent are displayed at this level.
(T3): Association Negotiation information is displayed at this level.
(T4): Association rejections are displayed at this level.
(T5): Message validation information is displayed at this level.
(T6): Configuration information (the content of toolkit's configuration files when the library is initialized) is displayed at this level.
(T7): Command elements of received or sent messages are displayed at this level.
(T8): Warnings encountered during stream operations are displayed at this level.
(T9): Protocol Data Units (PDUs) contained in received or sent messages are displayed at this level.

remarks.para: All methods on MClog are thread safe.

member.summary: Bitmask used to set the destination for a log level to file.

member.name: F:Mergecom.Logging.MClog.Memory_Destination

member.name: M:Mergecom.Logging.MClog.addHandler(Mergecom.Logging.MClogHandler)
member.summary: Adds a log handler to receive logging messages.

remarks.para: This method adds an implementation of the interface to the list of handler that will receive log messages.
Every log message will be given to all registered handlers.
Registering twice the same handler will result in that handler receiving twice every message.

member.param: The handler to add.

member.summary: Logs an Error message using the Merge DICOM toolkit logger.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Logging.MClog.throwing(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Logs an exception using the Merge DICOM toolkit logger.

remarks.para: This is a convenience method to log that a method is terminating by throwing an exception. The logging is done using the ERROR level.

If the logger is currently enabled for the given message level then the given arguments are stored in a LogRecord which is forwarded to all registered log handler objects. The caller's class and method name are automatically added to the log record.

member.param: The message to log.
The exception that is being thrown or has been thrown.
