member.name: M:Mergecom.MC.mcInitialization(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Initializes the Merge DICOM toolkit library and provides necessary configuration information.

remarks.para: This method may be called multiple times (by multiple application threads, for example) but the parameter must specify the same file path or an will be thrown. Each call must be paired with an call. After all required calls have been made, the library will permit an call using a different merge ini file specification.

Because this toolkit provides a wrapper to the native Merge DICOM toolkit, it cannot be used from different application domains at the same time. Applications using multiple application domains must ensure the toolkit is released in the current application domain before being able to initialize it in another application domain.

member.param: A object representing the merge.ini file's location. This parameter can be null.
member.exception: The library is already initialized with a different configuration file or the library is initialized in a different application domain..
The initialization failed. Check the merge.log file for details.
The native library (mergecom.native.dll) could not be loaded.
A proper license could not be detected.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MC.mcInitialization(System.IO.FileInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the Merge DICOM toolkit library and provides necessary configuration information.

remarks.para: This method may be called multiple times (by multiple application threads, for example) but the parameter must specify the same file path or an will be thrown. Each call must be paired with an call. After all required calls have been made, the library will permit an call using a different merge ini file specification.

Because this toolkit provides a wrapper to the native Merge DICOM toolkit, it cannot be used from different application domains at the same time. Applications using multiple application domains must ensure the toolkit is released in the current application domain before being able to initialize it in another application domain.

member.param: A object representing the merge.ini file's location. This parameter can be null.
A input string representing valid license for Merge DICOM library. This parameter can be null.
member.exception: The library is already initialized with a different configuration file or the library is initialized in a different application domain.
The initialization failed. Check the merge.log file for details.
The native library (mergecom.native.dll) could not be loaded.
A proper license could not be detected.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MC.mcIsInitialized
member.summary: Determines whether the library is initialized for the current application domain.
member.returns: true if has been called successfully, otherwise false.
member.remarks: This method determines whether the method has been successfully called at least once. If the method was called at least one time without a corresponding call, this method returns true.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MC.mcLibraryRelease
member.summary: Performs a graceful shutdown of the library.

remarks.para: The library is not released until is called the same number of times that the method was called.
This call is ignored if the library is not initialized.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MC.mcCleanupMemory(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cleanup unmanaged memory associated with the C library.
member.param: A timeout, in seconds, for the cleanup method. If this parameter is zero, the method runs until the cleanup is complete.
member.returns: true if the cleanup is complete, false if the operation timed out.

remarks.para: This method allows an application to reduce the amount of memory consumed by the toolkit. The Merge toolkit uses an internal memory management system to increase performance. This increase in performance is at the expense of keeping allocated memory block available by not freeing them to the operating system. This call allows memory blocks not in use to be returned to the operating system.

This call can take a significant amount of time if a large amount of memory is to be freed. The timeout can be used to make incremental improvements in the memory usage. Calls to this method pick up where the previous call left off. If the timeout expires before the cleanup is complete, false is returned.

member.exception: has not been called yet
The argument was less than 0.
Unexpected status returned by the native library.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MC.GetKeywords
member.summary: This method returns a of DICOM attribute tags and associated string keywords.
member.returns: of DICOM attributes tags and associated string keywords.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MC.SetLibraryExceptionHandler(Mergecom.MC.ExceptionHandler)
member.param: Exception handler

member.name: P:Mergecom.MC.ReportInvalidEncodingWarning
member.summary: This property determines whether invalid attribute warnings are reported.
member.value: true if setting invalid attribute values will generate an exception.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is true.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MC.AllowNonASCIIDefaultEncoding
member.summary: This property determines how the string attributes are encoded if DICOM (0008,0005) character set attribute is not present.
member.value: If false the string encoding is done using ISO-IR 6 character set and if true the specific character set of Windows System Locale is used.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MC.AssocWaitInCallerThread
member.summary: This property determines if the associations will wait for read events in its own thread if false or in the caller thread if true.
member.remarks:
The default value of this property is true.
Setting the property to true will allow the caller to dispatch commands on a server association in multiple threads for true asynchronous/parallel processing.
This is a global setting and will affect all objects created in the application. If you want to modify the behaviour on an individual, per- basis, use MCassociation.WaitInCallerThread.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MC.AllowRenumberPrivateTags
member.summary: This property allows private tags to be renumbered on copying private attributes in sequent order
member.value: true if private tags are allowed to be renumbered (DICOM standard behavior)
member.remarks: The default value of this property is true.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCacceptor
member.summary: Defines the method to handle incoming association requests.

remarks.para: Applications that will provide a server that listens for DICOM association requests and processes them need to provide an implementation of this interface.

When an association request arrives at a specific port for a specific DICOM application, the Merge DICOM toolkit starts a new thread and calls the start method to process the received association request.
The method of the class is used to provide the Merge DICOM toolkit with an object that implements this interface.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCacceptor.start(Mergecom.MCassociation)
member.summary: Starts processing of the user's acceptor handler thread. The thread will end when start() returns.
member.remarks: If start() fails to catch an Exceptions, - a message will be logged.
member.param: representing the received association.

The escape sequences that activate this character set. The first sequence set is the GO code escape sequence where the second one is for G1. This parameter must be null if code extension is not supported.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Util.DicomCharset.#ctor(System.String,System.String[],System.Byte[][],System.Int32[])
member.param: The Dicom defined term for the character set.
The aliases of the character set.

The escape sequences that activate this character set. The first sequence set is the GO code escape sequence where the second one is for G1. This parameter must be null if code extension is not supported.

The encoded byte ranges that valid character encodings are limited to. This argument is optional. The format of this argument is [a0,a1,..,,an-1, an] where the valid ranges would be [a0, a1] ... [an-1, an]. The ranges are inclusive. For individual encodings the range should start and end with the same value. If no range is intended to be specified pass null.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Util.DicomCharset.getStreamEscapeSequence(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is used to get an escaped form of the escape sequence associated with this DICOM character set. For code extension character sets with G0 defaulted to IR-6, first escape sequence is the G1 element since G0 escape sequence is implied and not available. For code extension character set Japanese IR-13, first escape sequence is G0 (really is IR-14 Romaji) and second escape sequence is G1 (Katakana). So far, Japanese IR-13 is the only special case where it has both G0 and G1 escape sequences. Other character sets have only one (either G0 or G1) escape sequence in DicomCharset.
member.param: The escape sequence index (0 is first, 1 is second etc).
member.returns: The escape sequence for the indes.

member.name: M:Mergecom.Util.DicomCharset.getStreamEscapeSequence
member.summary: This method is used to get an escaped form of the first escape sequence associated with this DICOM character set.
member.returns: The first escape sequence

member.summary: This method is used to get an replacement charactes of associated with this DICOM character set.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCapplication
member.remarks: The MCapplication class represents an instance of a DICOM application entity. Each DICOM entity is identified by a 1-16 byte application entity title. Association negotiation, for example, uses an application's entity title to create a network connection between two participating applications.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCapplication.getApplication(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the MCapplication object associated with an AE title.
member.remarks: If there is no application object registered under the specified AE title this method creates a new one and registers it with the Merge DICOM .NET toolkit. If the application has already been created, that instance is returned.
member.param: The Application Entity Title of the requested application.
member.returns: An instances for the requested AE title
member.exception: Thrown if aeTitle is null or it has an invalid value.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCapplication.isValidAE(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if a string is a valid DICOM Application Entity Title.
member.param: A string containing the application entity title.
member.returns: true if the string value validates according to the encoding rules for application entity titles.

remarks.para: This method gives the library the opportunity to release any object references it may have in this application.
Any attempt to use this application object after it was dispose will result in an exception being thrown. To get a new application instance for the same AE Title use method.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCapplication.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if this application equals another object.
member.param: The object to compare to.
member.returns: true if the object is an instance of and it has the same AE title.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCapplication.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code representing this application.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCapplication.registerAttributeContainer(Mergecom.MCtag,Mergecom.MCattributeContainer)
member.summary: Registers an attribute value container for this application.

remarks.para: This method informs Merge DICOM toolkit that the instance will be responsible for maintaining the value of a given attribute. Methods of the registered are called by Merge DICOM toolkit to provide or retrieve an attribute's values as they are transmitted or received on a DICOM association or read or written to a DICOM file.
This method may only be called for attributes with Value Representations of OB, OW, OL, OD or OF.

member.param: The tag of the attribute for which the container is registered.
The attribute value container to register.
member.returns: The previously registered attribute container or null if there was no attribute container registered.
member.exception: One of the arguments was invalid.
The application has been disposed.
member.remarks: Please note that the method works correctly for standard attributes and for private attribute whose private creator code is an ASCII string as MCapplication does not have a specific character set context to be able to encode Unicode strings.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCapplication.releaseAttributeContainer(Mergecom.MCtag)
member.summary: Releases an attribute value container previously registered.
member.remarks: This method releases the value container object that was registered for the attribute identified by tag. The container's methods will no longer be called when the attribute's value is being received or when the attribute's value is required. The container's methods will still be called, however, for objects or objects that were created before this method was called.
member.param: The tag that identifies the attribute for which the container was registered.
member.exception: The argument was null.
member.remarks: Please note that the method works correctly for standard attributes and for private attribute whose private creator code is an ASCII string as MCapplication does not have a specific character set context to be able to encode Unicode strings.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCapplication.ApplicationTitle
member.summary: Gets the DICOM Application Entity Title that identifies this application.
member.value: A String representing this application's entity title.

Diagnostic: reason for rejection
A. If source == 1: 1 - no-reason-given, 2 - application-context-name-not-recognized, 4-6 - reserved, 7 - called-AE-title-not-recognized, 8-10 - reserved
B. If source = 2: 1 - no-reason-given, 2 - protocol-version-not-supported
C. If source = 3: 0 - reserved, 1 - temporary-congestion, 2 - local-limit-exceeded, 3-7 - reserved

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCassociation
member.remarks: This class represents a connection established between two DICOM application entities. It can be instantiated such that a specified will serve the Service Class User (SCU) role and/or the Service Class Provider (SCP) role. The connection (known as an association) supports the exchange of network messages related to specifically negotiated DICOM services.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCassociation.MAX_CONCURRENT_ASSOCIATIONS
member.summary: Maximum number of concurrent associations allowed by the library.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.getThreadsAssociation
member.summary: Returns the association that is being handled by the current thread.
member.remarks: This method is to be used by instances to determine which association is being handled by the current thread.
member.returns: The object being handled by the current thread or null if no association is running on the current thread.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.dispose
member.summary: This routine disposes of native resources related to the association.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.abort
member.summary: Requests that the association be aborted.

remarks.para: Either an association acceptor or an association requestor may issue the abort request to bring an abrupt end to the association. The corresponding TCP/IP connection is also released. When this method call returns, the association is no longer "active".

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.accept
member.summary: Accepts an association request sent by an remote application.

remarks.para: Merge DICOM toolkit notifies the class when an association request is received from a remote DICOM application by calling its start method. The start method may call accept to indicate that it is satisfied with the parameters of the association as proposed by the remote requester application.

The Merge DICOM toolkit library has already determined that both the local and remote applications wish to perform at least one common service. The and properties may be used to examine the services that are agreeable to both sides. Several other properties are available to inquire about the remote application. If this application agrees with the acceptable services, it issues this accept method to establish an association between the two applications.
Note that a method call may be made to reject the association request.

member.exception: The association was aborted.
The call is not appropriate in the current context.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.accept(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Accepts an association request sent by an remote application with User Identity server response.

remarks.para: Merge DICOM toolkit notifies the class when an association request is received from a remote DICOM application by calling its start method. The start method may call accept to indicate that it is satisfied with the parameters of the association as proposed by the remote requester application.

The Merge DICOM toolkit library has already determined that both the local and remote applications wish to perform at least one common service. The and properties may be used to examine the services that are agreeable to both sides. Several other properties are available to inquire about the remote application. If this application agrees with the acceptable services, it issues this accept method to establish an association between the two applications.
Note that a method call may be made to reject the association request.

member.param: If the association requestor has requested a positive acknowledgment the response has to be the Kerberos Server ticket if User Identity value was Kerberos Service ticket (3) or the SAML assertion if User Identity value was SAML Assertion (4).
member.exception: The association was aborted.
The call is not appropriate in the current context.

This information is retrieved using the and methods. If there is no further need to retrieve the information, this method may be called to free up the resources needed to store the information.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.read(System.Int64)
member.summary: Requests that a DIMSE message be read from the network.
member.remarks:
DICOM messages are exchanged over an active association connection. After successfully constructing a new object and negotiating the association parameters, applications must read for DIMSE messages sent by the remote application. (DIMSE stands for DICOM Message Service Element.)
A DICOM service class user (SCU) sends request messages to the remote application to request that a service be performed. The service class provider (SCP) responds by sending one or more response messages back. The read method is used to retrieve these request and response messages.
Once a message begins arriving, the INACTIVITY_TIMEOUT configuration value is used. While receiving the message, the association will be aborted if there is no activity on the network for the length of time specified by this configuration value.
When a message arrives, the Merge DICOM toolkit returns an object. That object encapsulates both the DIMSE command set and the DIMSE data set which comprise the message. Methods of the class provide access to the command set ( object) and data set ( object).
Normally, attributes of the command set may be accessed by using methods of the class rather than interrogating the object. The name of the service associated with the message may be obtained using the getServiceName method of the class.
If the message is a request message, methods of one of the classes are used to send a response to the remote application.
NOTES: A read operation requires that a previous partial reading operation if there is one, readToTag or continueReadToTag read to the end of the message, otherwise the operation is not allowed.
member.param: The time (in milliseconds, but gets rounded to the nearest second) to wait for a message to arrive. Zero (0) means "check one time" and minus one (-1) means "wait forever".
member.returns: An instance of containing the received message. If a timeout occurs, null is returned.
member.exception: The remote network partner released the network connection. The association is no longer active and no further network activity may be requested.

The association has been aborted by local or remote application or by the local or remote DIMSE provider (e.g. Merge DICOM toolkit). A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file. No further network activity may be requested.
An inactivity timeout occurred on the network during the read operation. The association is no longer active and no further network activity may be requested.

An improperly formatted DICOM message was received. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file. The association is no longer active and no further network activity may be requested.
The network connection unexpectedly dropped. The association is no longer active and no further network activity may be requested.

An error occurred in the operating environment while processing the request. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file. The association is no longer active and no further network activity may be requested.
If a previous partial reading operation readToTag or continueReadToTag didn't read to the end of the message.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.read(System.Int64,Mergecom.MCReadError@)
member.summary: Requests that a DIMSE message be read from the network.
member.remarks:
It has the same functionality with . The difference lies on the style of dealing with errors. Instead of throwing all kinds of exceptions, it stores the reading operation error in a object which is passed by reference as an argument.
NOTES: A read operation requires that a previous partial reading operation if there is one, readToTag or continueReadToTag read to the end of the message, otherwise the operation is not allowed.
member.param: The time (in milliseconds, but gets rounded to the nearest second) to wait for a message to arrive. Zero (0) means "check one time" and minus one (-1) means "wait forever".
A object that stores the "read" operation error .
member.returns: An instance of containing the received message.If a reading error occurs, null is returned.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.readToTag(System.Int64,System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCReadError@)
member.summary: Reads one message intended for the caller up until a specified tag
member.remarks: NOTES: A readToTag operation requires that a previous partial reading operation if there is one, readToTag or continueReadToTag read to the end of the message, otherwise the operation is not allowed.
member.param: The time (in milliseconds, but gets rounded to the nearest second) to wait for a message to arrive. Zero (0) means "check one time" and minus one (-1) means "wait forever".
Read up to and include this tag when reading from the remote application. Must be outside the command section ( greater than or equal to (0001,0000))
A object that stores the "read" operation error .
member.returns: An instance of containing the received message. If a reading error occurs, null is returned.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.continueReadToTag(System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCdimseMessage)
member.summary: Reads one message intended for the caller up until the specified tag, starting from the previous ToTag call.
member.remarks: continueReadToTag requires that a previous readToTag or continueReadToTag was called, otherwise the operation is not allowed.
member.param: Read up to and include this tag when reading from the remote application. Must be outside the command section ( greater than or equal to (0001,0000))

An instance of containing the received message which was returned from previous readToTag or continueReadToTag call. continueReadToTag doesn't create another new message, it just adds more attributes to the if the previous operation didn't read to the end of the message.
member.returns: A object that stores the "read" operation error.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.continueReadToStream(Mergecom.MCdataSink,Mergecom.MCdimseMessage)
member.summary: Continues the reading of the current message to a data sink
member.remarks: continueReadToStream requires that a previous readToTag or continueReadToTag was called, otherwise the operation is not allowed.
member.param: The destination for the received message
An instance of containing the received message which was returned from previous readToTag or continueReadToTag call.
member.returns: A object that stores the "read" operation error .

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.continueRead(Mergecom.MCdimseMessage)
member.summary: Reads one message intended for the caller until the end finishing any previous ToTag calls.
member.remarks: continueRead requires that a previous readToTag or continueReadToTag was called, otherwise the operation is not allowed.
member.param: An instance of containing the received message which was returned from previous readToTag or continueReadToTag call. continueRead doesn't create another new message, it just adds more attributes to the if the previous operation didn't read to the end of the message.
member.returns: A object that stores the "read" operation error .

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.readToStream(Mergecom.MCdataSink,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Reads data to a data sink
member.remarks: ReadToStream dosn't require previous read, readToTag or continueReadToTagwas called.
member.param: The destination for the received message
The time (in milliseconds, but gets rounded to the nearest second) to wait for a message to arrive. Zero (0) means "check one time" and minus one (-1) means "wait forever".
The destination name for the received message (may be null)
member.returns: A object that stores the "read" operation error .

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.reject
member.summary: Rejects an association request received from a remote application. The type of rejection is transient and the source is UL service user. No reason is given for the rejection.
member.exception: The association was aborted.
The method was called at an inappropriate time.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.reject(System.Boolean,Mergecom.MCrejectReason)
member.summary: Rejects an association request received from a remote application.
member.param: If true the rejection is permanent and no further association requests are expected.
One of the reasons specified by the enum.
member.exception: The association was aborted.
The method was called at an inappropriate time.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.reject(Mergecom.MCrejectReason)
member.summary: Rejects an association request received from a remote application.
member.param: One of the reasons specified by the enum.
member.exception: The association was aborted.
The method was called at an inappropriate time.
member.remarks: The value of the reason parameter determines the transient or permanent character of the rejection.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.reject(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Rejects an association request received from a remote application.
member.param: Permanent or transient rejection (1, 2)
A valid DICOM sourcr code (1, 2, 3)
A valid DICOM reason code (1, 2, 3, 7)
member.exception: The association was aborted.
The method was called at an inappropriate time.
member.remarks:
The value of the reason parameter determines the transient or permanent character of the rejection.
See the DICOM Standard (DICOM PS3.8 2018c, Section 9.3.4 A-ASSOCIATE-RJ PDU Structure for more details.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.release

remarks.para: An association requestor can release an association when it has completed its work for the association.
Note that an association acceptor cannot release an association. It is required by DICOM to an association if it wants to close the association.
When an association requester application releases the association, the two application entities must react as follows:

item.description: Once the release method is called, the association is considered inactive and the requester may no longer make any method calls other than an . objects created for this association may no longer send messages to the association partner. The requestor may, however, continue to receive messages until it is informed that the association has been closed.

list.description: The Merge DICOM toolkit library automatically responds to release association request received from the association requestor. An association acceptor simply continues to receive messages until it is informed the association has been released. The acceptor may also issue an at any time.

member.exception: The association is called at an invalid time or by an associationacceptor.
The association has been aborted

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.requestAssociation(Mergecom.MCapplication,Mergecom.MCremoteApplication,System.Int32)
member.summary: Request that the Merge DICOM toolkit establish a DICOM association between this application and a remote DICOM application.

remarks.para: Two options are available for processing the resulting association. If the thread that is making the requestAssociation call wishes to process the association that results from this call, a form without an parameter should be used. In that case, an object is returned and the calling thread uses that object to send and receives DICOM messages over the association.

Alternatively, methods that include an parameter are used to have a separate thread process the resulting association. In that case, the start method of the handler provided is called by Merge DICOM toolkit from a newly created thread after the association has been negotiated, passing an object. When the handler returns from its start method the thread in which it is running is ended. Refer to the interface for more details on the handler.

The object that results from this method call represents a connection established between two DICOM application entities. An application can be either an association acceptor or an association requestor, but not both on the same association connection. An association acceptor waits for incoming connections and decides whether or not to accept the proposed association. An association requester connects to a remote application and requests that it accept its proposed association. If the application is to serve both as an association acceptor and as association requester, multiple instances must be started. Refer to the method for information on how to play the acceptor role.

For some forms of this method, before requesting a new instance, an object may be created and supplied as the contextList argument. If any of the proposed services need negotiation information the MCproposedContextList.setNegotiationInfo method must be used to provide the negotiation information to Merge DICOM toolkit.

As a result of calling this method, the library will attempt to negotiate an association with the remote DICOM application. When the association request is received by the remote DICOM system, the remote application must be able to perform at least one of the services in this application's service list. If not, the remote DICOM system rejects the request and an is thrown. The remote application may also reject the association request for other reasons. If the association is accepted, several properties are available to retrieve information about the services that were acceptable to both sides.
If the remote application releases or aborts the association, the library will notify the local application in response to a read method call of the class, by throwing either or .
Methods of the sub-classes are used to send messages over the opened association connection.

member.param: An instance for the local application opening the association.
An instance to connect to.
Connect timeout for this association request only (supersedes the global CONNECT_TIMEOUT configuration setting)
member.returns: An instance for the connected association.
member.exception: One of the arguments was null.
The remoteHostName is unknown to the system, or the host name configured for remoteAeTitle is unknown to the system.

The remote DICOM application rejected the association request. The information about the circumstances and reason the association was rejected (result, source & reason) can be retrieved from the RejectInfo property of the .
The attempt to connect to the application on the remote host failed.
The association was aborted during the negotiation process. Normally this situation is handled by retrying.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.startListening(Mergecom.MCapplication,System.Net.IPEndPoint,System.Boolean,Mergecom.MCproposedContextList,Mergecom.MCacceptor)
member.summary: Request that the Merge DICOM toolkit listen for association requests directed to this application.

remarks.para: This method is used to start a socket listener so that this application is able to receive association requests from other applications.

Three forms of this method are available. All forms require an application object, an association handler and a list of the presentation contexts to be waited for. This form allows a specific address and listen port to be specified for the listener allowing the application to receive association request on specific network interfaces.

For IPv6 addresses the toolkit supports accepting both IPv6 and IPv4 connections on the same listener socket (dual-mode socket). This functionality can be enabled through the dualMode parameter and it is available only on platforms that support such sockets (Windows Vista and later). The dualMode parameter is ignored on other platforms.
Different applications can listen on the same address and port. Also the same application can listen on multiple addresses and/or ports.

The method requests that the Merge DICOM toolkit wait for association requests to arrive that propose to connect to this application and conduct at least one of the services specified in contextList. The application provides a instance as a handler for received associations. When an association request is received for this application and at least one of the services in contextList is acceptable to the remote application, the Merge DICOM toolkit calls the start method of the handler, passing the object that represents the association being negotiated. It is the handler's responsibility to call either the or methods on the association object to accept or reject it.

Each association request is handled in a separate thread, meaning the method of the handler is called by the toolkit in a thread reserved for that association. The lifetime of the association is tied to the call, after the method returns the application is considered inactive, and no further operations are accepted on the association. After an association ends, the Merge DICOM toolkit will reuse the association's thread for a future association.

If the association is rejected, no further method calls may be made on that particular association. If the association is accepted, the read method of the object is used to read DIMSE messages on the association, and methods of one of the derived class are used to send DIMSE messages over the association.

The association connection may end if either this application or the remote application aborts or if the requester releases the association. (See and methods.) If the remote application releases or aborts the association, this local application is notified by exceptions thrown by the method.
To have the Merge DICOM toolkit stop listening for connections on a given port for this application, use the method.

Service Lists are encapsulated in : Before starting to listen for associations, an object must be created and supplied as the contextList argument. If any of the proposed services need negotiation information the method must be used to provide the negotiation information to the Merge DICOM toolkit.

member.param: The application for which to start the listener.
The address and port number to start the listener on.
This parameter controls whether an IPv6 listener will accept IPv4 connections. See the remarks section for more details on availability of this feature.
A list of DICOM services supported on the received association.
An object that will handle incoming associations.
member.returns: The port number listening on.
member.exception: An invalid argument was specified.
The Merge DICOM toolkit is already listening on the port.

An error occurred in the operating environment while processing the request. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file. The association is no longer active and no further network activity may be requested.

If the association is accepted, the read method of the object is used to read DIMSE messages on the association, and methods of one of the derived class are used to send DIMSE messages over the association.

The association connection may end if either this application or the remote application aborts or if the requester releases the association. (See and methods.) If the remote application releases or aborts the association, this local application is notified by exceptions thrown by the method.
To have the Merge DICOM toolkit stop listening for connections on a given port for this application, use the method.

Service Lists are encapsulated in : Before starting to listen for associations, an object must be created and supplied as the contextList argument. If any of the proposed services need negotiation information the MCproposedContextList.setNegotiationInfo method must be used to provide the negotiation information to the Merge DICOM toolkit.

The toolkit will listen for connections on all network interfaces, but depending on the IP_TYPE configuration option it will set up either an IPv4 or an IPv6 socket listener. If the IP_TYPE configuration value is 'AVAILABLE' the toolkit will set up an IPv6 listener if the system supports it and an IPv4 listener if not. By default Merge-COM-3 is configured to use only IPv4 sockets.

member.param: The application for which to start the listener.
The port number to listen on.
A list of DICOM services supported on the received association.
An object that will handle incoming associations.
member.returns: The port number listening on.
member.exception: An invalid argument was specified.
The Merge DICOM toolkit is already listening on the port.

An error occurred in the operating environment while processing the request. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file. The association is no longer active and no further network activity may be requested.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCassociation.startListening(Mergecom.MCapplication,System.Int32,Mergecom.MCproposedContextList,Mergecom.MCacceptor,Mergecom.MCsecureContext)
member.summary: Request that the Merge DICOM toolkit listen for association requests directed to this application.

remarks.para: This method is used to start a socket listener so that this application is able to receive association requests from other applications.

Three forms of this method are available. All forms require an application object, an association handler and a list of the presentation contexts to be waited for. This form allows a listen port to be specified as a parameter. Applications can listen on same port multiple times with different Application Entity titles.

The method requests that the Merge DICOM toolkit wait for association requests to arrive that propose to connect to this application and conduct at least one of the services specified in contextList. The application provides a instance as a handler for received associations. When an association request is received for this application and at least one of the services in contextList is acceptable to the remote application, the Merge DICOM toolkit calls the start method of the handler, passing the object that represents the association being negotiated. It is the handler's responsibility to call either the or methods on the association object to accept or reject it.

Each association request is handled in a separate thread, meaning the MCacceptor.start method of the handler is called by the toolkit in a thread reserved for that association. The lifetime of the association is tied to the MCacceptor.start call, after the method returns the application is considered inactive, and no further operations are accepted on the association. After an association ends, the Merge DICOM toolkit will reuse the association's thread for a future association.

If the association is rejected, no further method calls may be made on that particular association. If the association is accepted, the read method of the object is used to read DIMSE messages on the association, and methods of one of the derived class are used to send DIMSE messages over the association.

The association connection may end if either this application or the remote application aborts or if the requester releases the association. (See and methods.) If the remote application releases or aborts the association, this local application is notified by exceptions thrown by the method.
To have the Merge DICOM toolkit stop listening for connections on a given port for this application, use the method.

Service Lists are encapsulated in : Before starting to listen for associations, an object must be created and supplied as the contextList argument. If any of the proposed services need negotiation information the MCproposedContextList.setNegotiationInfo method must be used to provide the negotiation information to the Merge DICOM toolkit.

The toolkit will listen for connections on all network interfaces, but depending on the IP_TYPE configuration option it will set up either an IPv4 or an IPv6 socket listener. If the IP_TYPE configuration value is 'AVAILABLE' the toolkit will set up an IPv6 listener if the system supports it and an IPv4 listener if not. By default Merge-COM-3 is configured to use only IPv4 sockets.

member.param: The application for which to start the listener.
The port number to listen on.
A list of DICOM services supported on the received association.
An object that will handle incoming associations.
MCsecureContext of SSL session
member.returns: The port number listening on.
member.exception: An invalid argument was specified.
The Merge DICOM toolkit is already listening on the port.

An error occurred in the operating environment while processing the request. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file. The association is no longer active and no further network activity may be requested.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.ApplicationContextName
member.summary: Gets the application context name used for the association.
member.remarks: This value is the result of negotiation. Originally this is the context name as specified by the LocalApplicationContextName configuration parameter. The association acceptor may supply a different context. If the association requester doesn't like the new context supplied by the acceptor it should issue an abort request.
member.value: The DICOM Application Context Name used for this association.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.CalledApplicationTitle
member.summary: Retrieves the application entity title of the acceptor application.
member.value: The DICOM AE title of the called application.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.CallingApplicationTitle
member.summary: Retrieves the application entity title of the application that requested this association.
member.value: The DICOM AE title of the calling application.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.FirstAcceptableContext
member.summary: Retrieves the first acceptable context for this association.

remarks.para: An acceptable context describes a service that is acceptable to both the local application and the remote application. The object returned describes the service and provides the transfer syntax that has been negotiated for use with the service, as well as other items that may have been negotiated.
This method may be called by an association acceptor to examine the contexts proposed by the remote association requester.

The Merge DICOM library automatically accepts contexts received from the remote requestor if the service proposed matches one of the services in the local acceptor's (see the startListening methods), and if one of the transfer syntaxes proposed matches one of the transfer syntaxes in the corresponding of the local acceptor's . If not, the library automatically rejects the proposed context.
An association requester may use this method to review the contexts that have been accepted by the remote application.

member.value: The object representing the first acceptable context, or null if there is none.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.ListenPort

member.value: The port number this acceptor is using or zero if the local application is not an acceptor.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.LocalApplication
member.summary: Retrieves the local application identifying that is using this association.
member.value: The associated object.

member.remarks: Note that, for an acceptor application, this may not be the same as that returned by the CalledApplicationTitle property if the local application has elected to accept association requests directed to other application titles.
member.value: A String containing the local application title.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.Acceptor
member.summary: Determines if the local application is an association acceptor (or an association requester).
member.value: true if the local application is an association acceptor.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.Active
member.summary: Determines if the association is active.

remarks.para: For a DICOM association requester application, an association is considered active from the moment the requester receives a successful return from the call until it calls the release method or until the association is aborted by either the local requester or remote acceptor application.

For a DICOM association acceptor application, an association is considered active from the moment the local acceptor calls the accept method until the association is released by the remote requester or until the association is aborted by either the local acceptor or remote requester application.

item.term: Association Release by the association requester:
item.description: When an association requester application releases the association, the two application entities must react as follows:

Once the release method is called, the association is considered inactive and the requester may no longer make any method calls other than an abort. MCassociation objects created for this association may no longer send messages to the association partner. The requestor may, however, continue to receive messages until it is informed that the association has been closed.

The Merge DICOM toolkit library automatically responds to release association request received from the association requestor. An association acceptor simply continues to receive messages until it is informed the association has been released. The acceptor may also issue an abort call at any time.

description.para: When either application entity issues an abort method call it may no longer receive messages and its service classes may no longer send request messages. The association is terminated immediately.

Therefore, an association is no longer active (i.e. this method returns false). When a release method call is made by an association requester application. When a DICOM association acceptor is notified that the association has been released. When an abort method call is made by either side.

member.value: true if the association is active.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.Requester
member.summary: Determines if the local application is an association requester (or an association acceptor).
member.value: true if the local application is an association requester.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.UserIdentity
member.summary:
Return the type of the association.
Value Meaning
0 Undefined User Identity
1 Username as a string in UTF-8
2 Username as a string in UTF-8 and passcode
3 Kerberos Service ticket
4 SAML Assertion
5 JSON Web Token (JWT)

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.UserIdentityPrimaryField
member.returns: Returns the user identity, either the username as a series of characters, or the Kerberos Service ticket encoded in accordance with RFC-1510, or the JWT encoded in accordance with RFC 7519 using base64url encoded parts.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.UserIdentitySecondaryField
member.returns: Returns the passcode value only if User Identity is MCuserIdentity.USERNAME_AND_PASSCODE.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.UserIdentityResponse
member.returns: Returns the Kerberos Server ticket if User Identity value was Kerberos Service ticket (3) or the SAML response if the User Identity value was SAML Assertion (4) and if the Association requestor has requested a positive acknowledgment.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.UserIdentityResponseRequested
member.summary: Returns True if user identity response was requested.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.UserIdentityResponseReceived
member.summary: Returns True if user identity response was received.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCassociation.WaitInCallerThread
member.summary: This property determines if the association will wait for read events in its own thread if false or in the caller thread if true.
member.remarks:
The default value of this property is true.
Setting the property to true will allow the caller to dispatch commands on a server association in multiple threads for true asynchronous/parallel processing.
This is an individual, per- basis setting and will affect only the association it is applied to. If you want to modify the behaviour on a global basis, use MC.AssocWaitInCallerThread.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCReadError.OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCattribute.Tag
member.summary: Gets the tag identifying this attribute.
member.value: An MCtag object.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCattribute.ValueRepresentation
member.summary: Gets and sets the attribute's DICOM Value Representation.
member.value: An MCvr object identifying the DICOM Value Representation of this attribute.

remarks.para: When setting this property the toolkit will attempt to convert the value of the attribute to the proper type. Note that conversions from unknown VR to string types that depend on the specific character set are done using the default dicom character set.

The change in VR is reflected locally in the attribute, while the data element remains unchanged, so it is possible that has a different value than .VR. This is because data elements can be shared between attributes.
When setting this property, valid conversions are: US -> SS, SS -> US, SS -> OW, US -> OW, OW -> US, OW -> SS, OW -> OB, OB -> OW, UN -> Any VR.
If an attribute is a bulk attribute, namely pixel data, it can only be converted between OW and OB but not to SS or US.

member.exception: Data type not convertible.
The target VR is invalid.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCattribute.MultipleValuesDelimitation
member.summary: This property allows for attributes to set multiple string values, i.e. concatenated with backslash '\\' delimiters, as a single string without delimitation
member.value: true = DICOM standard behavior, when multiple string values are delimited
member.remarks: The default value of this property is true.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCattribute.Element
member.summary: Gets the data element associated with this attribute.
member.value: An MCdataElement object.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCattribute.ValueLength
member.summary: Gets the data length of this attribute's value.
member.value: A uint representing the total length of the attribute's values. For string type attributes (AE, AS, CS, DA, DS, DT, IS, LO, PN, SH, TM, UI, LT, ST, UT) the length returned is the total number of characters of this attribute's values including the values separators if there is more than one value. For binary tipe values (SS, US, AT, SL, UL, FL, FD, UN, OB, OW, OL, OD, OF) the length is the total number of bytes in the encoded value. For sequence attributes (SQ) the length returned is the number of items contained in the sequence.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCattribute.IsBulk
member.summary: Checks whether this attribute is an OB, OW, OL, OD or OF type attribute.
member.value: true if this attribute's value is bulk data; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCattribute.ParentId
member.summary: Gets AttributeSet Id hosting the current attribute
member.value: An MCattributeSet Id or -1 if there is no AttributeSet host

members.member:
Gets or sets values of this attribute. In C#, this property is the indexer for the MCattribute class.
Gets or sets values of this attribute.
The zero based index of the value to get or set.
An object representing the value at the specified index. The concrete type of the object is determined by the value representation of the attribute.
This property provides an array view for the values of this attribute.
If the attribute does not have the specified value, attempting to get it returns a null reference, and attempting to set it adds it to the list of existing values increasing the Count property to index + 1.
When setting this property, if the specified value already exists, the value is replaced otherwise a new value is added and all intermediate values are set to null or 0. For example setting the value with index 3 on an attribute with one value (Count == 1) will set the fourth value to the assigned object and set the second and third values to null. If the value assigned is an array of objects all elements of the array are set or added to the list of values of this attribute starting with the value specified by the index parameter.
This property is thread-safe.
The VR of this attribute is OB, OW, OL, OD or OF.
When setting this property, the type of the value specified is incompatible with the VR of this attribute.
When setting this property, the value contains invalid characters for the VR of the attribute. When getting this attribute, is not a valid value for the attribute."

member.summary: Gets a value of this attribute using a specified default value if the requested attribute does not exist.

The value to return if a value with the specified index does not exist.
member.value: An object representing the value at the specified index.

remarks.para: The concrete type of the object is determined by the value representation of the attribute.
This property is thread-safe.

member.exception: The VR of this attribute is OB, OW, OL, OD or OF.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCbulkDataUriHandler
member.summary: An interface to handle BulkDataURI attribute when dealing with Native DICOM Model XML or DICOM JSON Model.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCbulkDataUriHandler.provideData(Mergecom.MCattributeSet,System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCvr,System.String)
member.summary: Receive a BulkDataURI from parsing XML native or JSON. Implementation should provide data by returning an array of data according to the VR type (by retrieving the data from the URI location) to the toolkit for creating a proper attribute with value. If implementation returns null, the incoming attribute will contain a ValueLength of 0 (i.e. attribute in message but zero value length). For JSON stream with multiple data sets ( MCdataSet.readDataSetsFromJSON(System.IO.TextReader, MCbulkDataUriHandler)), the parameter attrSet is used to identify the current data set in process. For any other API, the attrSet value is a temporary variable supplied only for consistency of the interface, user shouldn't use the attrSet value in this case.
member.param:
Only valid for
MCdataSet.readDataSetsFromJSON(System.IO.TextReader, MCbulkDataUriHandler) method, identifies the current data set in process
The attribute tag
The value representation
The received uri
member.returns: Array of data according to VR type

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCbulkDataUriHandler.provideUri(Mergecom.MCattributeSet,System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCvr)
member.summary: Send a BulkDataURI instead of actual bulk data. Implementation should return a URI location if it desires to send URI instead of the bulk data. If the return value is null or empty string, the toolkit will send the original data. This method will be called when generating XML native or JSON stream for one of the following vr: FL, FD, IS, LT, OB, OL, OD, OF, OW, SL, SS, ST, UL, UN, US, or UT. For JSON stream with multiple data sets ( MCdataSet.writeDataSetsToJSON), the parameter attrSet is used to identify the current data set in process. For any other API, the attrSet value is a temporary variable supplied only for consistency of the interface, user shouldn't use the attrSet value in this case.
member.param:
Only valid for
MCdataSet.writeDataSetsToJSON method, identifies the current data set in process
The attribute tag
The value repreentation
member.returns: uri string to be send in XML or JSON object

member.param: Pointer to the unmanaged memory buffer. If the pointer value is null the constructor allocates a new unmanaged buffer.
The length in bytes of the buffer.
Flag indicating whether the MCdata object should take ownership of the unmanaged buffer. If true, MCdata releases the unmanaged buffer when is called or when it is garbage collected.

member.summary: Creates a new MCdata object backed by a managed byte array.

member.param: The managed array holding the data
The length of data stored in .
member.exception: The data buffer was null.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdata.Finalize
member.summary: The destructor for the MCdata class.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdata.clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new MCdata instance containing the copy of the data.

remarks.para: The data stays managed or unmanaged depending on the source format of the data.
If this instance contains an unmanaged buffer, the returned instance will be the owner of its copy of the buffer.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdata.dispose
member.summary: This method is same with Dispose(). It was provided before the interface was implemented. Now it is kept for backward compatibility. Please use Dispose()

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdata.Dispose
member.summary: Implement . Disposes the buffer handled by this object.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdata.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this instance.
member.returns: A string describing the capacity and length of the buffer being managed by this object.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdata.IsLast
member.summary: Tells whether this buffer is the last buffer in a series of data passed to or read from the library.
member.value: true if this is the last piece of a transfer; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdata.IsPersistent
member.summary: Tells whether this buffer is the persistent memory buffer in a series of data passed.
member.value: true if this is the persistent memory buffer; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdata.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: Tells whether the buffer managed by this instance is an unmanaged buffer.
member.value: true if the backing store for this object is an unmanaged memory buffer; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdata.Capacity
member.summary: Represents the capacity of the buffer being managed by this object.
member.value: The maximum number of bytes this object can hold.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdata.Length
member.summary: Represents the size of the actual data in use within the buffer managed by this object.
member.value: The number of actual bytes in the buffer.
member.exception: The value exceeds the capacity of the buffer, when setting the property

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdata.UnmanagedBuffer
member.summary: The pointer to the unmanaged memory buffer.
member.value: An IntPtr containing the pointer to this instance's memory buffer.

remarks.para: If the buffer in this instance is unmanaged, this property returns the address of the unmanaged memory buffer.
If this instance is based on a managed byte array, a new unmanaged memory buffer is created for every call and any previous address returned by this property becomes invalid.
The returned address is valid until the current instance is disposed or garbage collected, except for instances based on unmanaged buffers that are not owners of the buffer.

member.exception: The data has been disposed.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdata.ManagedBuffer
member.summary: Represents the managed buffer of this instance.
member.value: A byte array containing the data represented by this instance.

remarks.para: If this instance is based on a managed byte array the reference to that array is returned.
If the buffer in this instance is unmanaged, a new byte array is created for every call. This means that modifying the elements of the returned array will not affect the data in this instance.

member.exception: The data has been disposed.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdataSet.validate(Mergecom.MCvalidationLevel)
member.summary: Validates all attributes in the attribute set. Ensures that the attribute values conform to the DICOM standard.
member.param: The requested level of validation.
member.returns: true if the data set is valid.

remarks.para: See MCabstractMessage.validate for specifics of the validation process.
Use to get details on the validation error after this method returns false.

member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdataSet.validateAttribute(System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCvalidationLevel)
member.summary: Ensures that an attribute value conform to the DICOM standard.
member.param: The tag number of the attribute to validate.
The requested level of validation.
member.returns: true if the attribute value is valid, otherwise false.

remarks.para: This method validates an attribute contained in the current data set to determine if its values are valid. The attribute is validated to insure that it meets the requirements of the service and command of the data set.
Performance tuning: validateAttribute() has a lower overhead than validate(). When validation is only required for a select group of attributes, this method should be used.

While the validation is quite comprehensive there are limitations in validation:
If the attribute was specified by DICOM Part 3 as being in either a user optional module, or a conditional module, it will always be treated as a Type 3 attribute (optional attribute).
The Ultrasound Image Object used in storage services has mutually exclusive Image, Overlay, and Curve information entities. The attributes defined in these entities are all treated as Type 3 (optional attributes).

In any case, this method is a powerful tool that can catch almost all problems with an attribute. The DICOM Standard should always be the final word on whether or not an attribute satisfies the DICOM protocol.

If the attribute is not valid a list of validation violations is created that can be retrieved using getNextValidationError() method. Also, the results of the validation are logged into the message log (usually merge.log) at the T5_MESSAGE level.

member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.
There is no attribute with the specified tag.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdataSet.getNextValidationError
member.summary: Gets validation error information created by the validate() or method.
member.returns: An MCvalidationError object describing the error or null if there are no more errors.
member.exception: The attribute set has been disposed.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdataSet.createSignature(System.UInt32[],System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2,System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm)
member.summary:
Creates a new digital signature (DICOM PS 3.3, C.12.1.1.3 Digital Signatures Macro) in the current object
Digital Signature uses a object which contains Public and Private keys. One of the ways to instantiate object is to use PKCS 12 file generated by openssl with private and public keys:
openssl pkcs12 -export -aes256 -CSP "Microsoft Enhanced RSA and AES Cryptographic Provider" -inkey privatekey.pem -in publickey.crt -out certificate.pfx
where CSP parameter defines Microsoft Cryptographic Service Provider.
member.param: A list of Data Element Tags that identify the Data Elements used in creating the MAC for the Digital Signature
PKCS 12 certificate object which contains X509 certificate and the corresponding private key
Hash algorithm object. Defined algorithms are: , , , , and
member.returns: true if Digital Signature is created successfully, false otherwise

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdataSet.createSignature(System.UInt32[],System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a new digital signature (DICOM PS 3.3, C.12.1.1.3 Digital Signatures Macro) in the current object
Digital Signature uses a object which contains Public and Private keys. One of the ways to instantiate object is to use PKCS 12 file generated by openssl with private and public keys:
openssl pkcs12 -export -aes256 -CSP "Microsoft Enhanced RSA and AES Cryptographic Provider" -inkey privatekey.pem -in publickey.crt -out certificate.pfx
where CSP parameter defines Microsoft Cryptographic Service Provider.
member.param: A list of Data Element Tags that identify the Data Elements used in creating the MAC for the Digital Signature
PKCS 12 certificate object which contains X509 certificate and the corresponding private key
Term for MAC Algorithm (0400,0015) attribute in Digital Signatures Macro (DICOM PS3.3, Table C.12-6). Defined Terms are "RIPEMD160", "MD5", "SHA1", "SHA256", "SHA384" and "SHA512"
member.returns: true if Digital Signature is created successfully, false otherwise

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdataSet.verifySignature
member.summary: Verifies a digital signature (DICOM PS 3.3, C.12.1.1.3 Digital Signatures Macro) in the current object
member.returns: true if Digital Signature is verified successfully, false otherwise

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdataSet.Command
member.summary: Gets he DIMSE Command for this data set.
member.value: An unsigned short representing the associated DIMSE Command. UInt16.MaxValue if the command was not set yet or the data set was disposed.
member.remarks:
The command code returned will be one of these defined by the class:
Composite Store Service Request and Reply: C_STORE_RQ, C_STORE_RSP
Composite Get Service Request, Reply and Cancel: C_GET_RQ, C_GET_RSP, C_CANCEL_GET_RQ
Composite Find Service Request, Reply and Cancel: C_FIND_RQ, C_FIND_RSP, C_CANCEL_FIND_RQ
Composite Move Service Request, Reply and Cancel: C_MOVE_RQ, C_MOVE_RSP, C_CANCEL_MOVE_RQ
Verification Service Request and Reply: C_ECHO_RQ, C_ECHO_RSP
Normalized Report Service Request and Reply: N_EVENT_REPORT_RQ, N_EVENT_REPORT_RSP
Normalized Get Service Request and Reply: N_GET_RQ, N_GET_RSP
Normalized Set Service Request and Reply: N_SET_RQ, N_SET_RSP
Normalized Action Service Request and Reply: N_ACTION_RQ, N_ACTION_RSP
Normalized Create Service Request and Reply: N_CREATE_RQ, N_CREATE_RSP
Normalized Delete Service Request and Reply: N_DELETE_RQ, N_DELETE_RSP

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCdataSource
member.summary: Defines the requirements for a class which will be called by the library when reading data from a source.

remarks.para: It is utilized by the when reading in DICOM Part 10 format files and by the class when streaming in DICOM "stream" format files.

For very large size data that potentially consumes a lot of memory, it is recommended to keep track of the object that is returned to the toolkit in each iteration to facilitate prompt disposal of the intermediate object. See the User Manual section "Using an MCdataSource class to assign an attribute value" for a detail example.

Use the following guideline to tackle large data size implementation: 1. Create an implementation of MCdataSource that also implements IDisposable interface. 2. Re-use the same buffer to create a MCdata object. 3. In the implementation, keep track of the MCdata returned to the toolkit. 4. Each time toolkit calls provideData interface, dispose the previous MCdata object if exists. 5. Dispose the impelementation after successfuly streamed or written out the entire DICOM object.
This interface is also used to read or provide bulk data values such as the pixel data.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdataSource.provideData(System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Called repeatedly to request blocks of a stream.

remarks.para: The caller sets first to true if this is the first time it is calling this method for all or a portion of the stream data.
The returned must contain an even number of bytes and may be empty. Its isLast field must be set to true if no more data is available.

member.param: true if the first block is being requested.
The origin of this call.
member.returns: A not null object containing the data requested.
member.exception: If there was a problem providing the data.

member.value: A five character string in the form *HHMM where * is + or -, or an empty string if there is no offset.
member.remarks: The returned string begins with either a plus(+) or minus(-) sign.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdateTime.Time
member.summary: The time portion of this date/time.
member.value: The representing the time portion of this date/time, or null if the time portion is not specified.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCdicom
member.summary: MCdicom structure contains fields representing tags from Part 6 of the DICOM Standard. As the standard changes the structure will be updated in order to remain current. In particular, the following changes can be expected: 1. New fields will be added as new tags are defined with new Supplements and Change Proposals. 2. Some fields will be appended with the _RETIRED suffix as tags are retired from the standard. 2. The list of aliases at the end of this structure will grow as tags are renamed in the standard.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage
member.summary: Encapsulates a DICOM message used by the DICOM Message Service Element (DIMSE) protocol.

remarks.para: DICOM provides for two kinds of DIMSE service messages: request messages sent by Service Class User (SCU) applications to Service Class Provider (SCP) applications, and response messages sent by SCP applications in reply to received request messages. In either case, MCdimseMessage objects are used to send messages to the remote application.

In some cases, the Merge DICOM toolkit classes create the MCdimseMessage instances. For example, the sendStoreRequest method of the class constructs the MCdimseMessage object and returns a reference to it. Another example is the read method of the class which returns a MCdimseMessage object containing the message just read.

DIMSE messages contain a command set ( object) and may also contain a data set ( object). The exact contents of the command set and data set depend on the service class defined by the DICOM standard. The and objects are automatically constructed when the MCdimseMessage is constructed.

The Merge DICOM toolkit concatenates the contents of the command set and the data set when streaming the message. Note that in many cases, the service class does not require any attributes be added to the data set.
This class provides methods to retrieve or set information in the command set. The CommandSet property returns the contained command set and the he DataSet property returns the contained data set.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs an "empty" DIMSE message with no pre-assigned attributes in the data set.

remarks.para: The message object is not associated with any particular DICOM service or command.
This form of the constructor is used if the service and command are not yet known, or if there is no need to validate the message.

If the object is to be used to send a message to a network partner, or if the
MCabstractMessage.validate(MCvalidationLevel) method is to be called, the method must be called first to associate this message object with a given DICOM service and command.

member.exception: A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
An error occurred involving the message info file. The exact error is logged in the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.#ctor(Mergecom.MCdataSet)
member.summary: Constructs a DIMSE message based on an existing data set.
member.param: The instance to use for the dimse message.

remarks.para: This form of the constructor creates a new instance that references a specific instance for its data set and a newly created object.

If the object is to be used to send a message to a network partner, or if the
MCabstractMessage.validate(MCvalidationLevel) method is to be called, the method must be called first to associate this message object with a given DICOM service and command.

member.exception: The argument was null.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
An error occurred involving the message info file. The exact error is logged in the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.#ctor(Mergecom.MCfile)
member.summary: Creates a new DIMSE message based on the data set of a DICOM file object.
member.param: A reference to a object.
member.remarks: This form of the constructor creates a new message object that shares the same object as that contained in the specified .
member.exception: The argument was null.
The file has been disposed.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
An error occurred involving the message info file. The exact error is logged in the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.#ctor(System.UInt16,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a DIMSE message providing both command code and service name.
member.param: One of the DIMSE command codes.
A non-null name of a DICOM service.
member.remarks:
This form of the constructor creates a message with a data set and a command set containing all the attributes of a DICOM message that will be used for the given service and command.
The service name and command are used to access configuration information that describes the attributes of the message. If such configuration information is not available, an empty message object is created, and a warning is logged.
The command code must be one of the values defined by the class.
member.exception: One of the arguments was invalid.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
An error occurred involving the message info file. The exact error is logged in the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this message.

member.summary: Lists the contents of the command set and data set contained in this message to the standard output stream .
member.exception: The message has been disposed.

member.summary: Lists the contents of the command set and data set contained in this message to a .
member.param: TextWriter object defining the output.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.putAttributeIdentifier(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a tag number to the values in the Attribute Identifier List attribute (0000,1005).
member.param: The tag number to add.

remarks.para: DIMSE services using N-GET operations use this command set attribute to provide an attribute tag for each of the attributes applicable to the N-GET operation.
If the attribute is not already in the message, it is added. The value provided is appended to any existing values for the attribute.

member.exception: The message has been disposed.
The Attribute Identifier List attribute is not valid for this message.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.putOffendingElement(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a value to the Offending Elements attribute (0000,0901).
member.param: The tag number of the offending data element
member.remarks: The Offending Element attribute is often used in error response message. If the attribute is not already in the message, it is added. The value provided is appended to any existing values for the attribute.
member.exception: The message has been disposed.
The Offending Elements attribute is not valid for this message.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.streamIn(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCtransferSyntax,Mergecom.MCdataSource)
member.summary: Requests the contents of a "streamed message" (a message in the form defined by the DICOM standard) be converted and placed in this message.
member.param: The tag number of the first attribute to decode.
The tag number of the last attribute to decode.
The transfer syntax of the encoded stream.
The source of the encoded stream.
member.returns: The byte offset in the stream where the decoding stopped.

remarks.para: Any attributes in the stream with tags less than or greater than will be ignored. Neither nor need to be in the stream.

If the stream contains any attributes with a value representation of SQ (i.e. the stream contains one or more sequences of items), an object is automatically created for each item in the stream. An object is used as the value for each item in each sequence attribute.

member.exception: The message has been disposed.

A tag was found in the stream that was not in ascending order or an invalid DICOM tag was detected in the stream or the stream ended without passing the entire value for an attribute or too many private blocks were encountered in the stream.
The stream returned an exception. See the inner exception for details.
Uneven data size returned by the stream.
One of the arguments was invalid.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.streamIn(Mergecom.MCtransferSyntax,Mergecom.MCdataSource)
