member.param: The transfer syntax of the encoded stream.
The source of the encoded stream.
member.returns: The byte offset in the source stream where the decoding stopped.

remarks.para: All attributes within the stream are to be placed into this message.

If the stream contains any attributes with a value representation of SQ (i.e. the stream contains one or more sequences of items), an object is automatically created for each item in the stream. An object is used as the value for each item in each sequence attribute.

member.exception: The message has been disposed.

A tag was found in the stream that was not in ascending order or an invalid DICOM tag was detected in the stream or the stream ended without passing the entire value for an attribute or too many private blocks were encountered in the stream.

Uneven data size returned by the stream.
One of the arguments was invalid.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.streamOut(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCtransferSyntax,Mergecom.MCdataSink)
member.summary: Creates a DICOM encoded stream from a portion of the command set and/or data set contained within this message.
member.param: The tag number of the first attribute to be streamed.
The tag number of the last attribute to be streamed.
The transfer syntax for the output stream.
The destination for the encoded data.

remarks.para: The streamed message is passed to the destination stream in blocks by calling MCdataSink.receiveData until the entire message has been transferred.
and specify which attributes in the message are to be placed in the stream. Any attributes in the message with tags less than or greater than will be ignored. Neither nor need to be in the message.

The transfer syntax specifies the byte order used in the streamed message, whether or not each attribute's value representation is explicitly encoded in the stream, and how the pixel data is encoded in the message.

member.exception: The message has been disposed.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.ActionTypeId
member.summary: Represents the Action Type ID attribute value from the message's command set.
member.value: An ushort representing the value of the Action Type ID attribute.

remarks.para: This property sets or gets the attribute Action Type Id (0000,1008) in the command set.

Normalized DICOM service classes make use of the N-ACTION DIMSE operation requesting that a specific action be performed by the peer DIMSE service user. Each SOP class using the N-ACTION service defines Action Type IDs that identify a specific service.
The attribute is added to the message, if necessary and any existing value is replaced by the one provided.

member.exception: The message has been disposed.
The attribute was not found when getting this property.
The attribute has no values.
An invalid value was being set for this property.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.AttributeIdentifiers
member.summary: Represents the Attribute Identifier List from the message's command set.
member.value: An array of uint values representing the value of the Attribute Identifier List attribute.

remarks.para: This property sets or gets the attribute Attribute Identifier list (0000,1005) in the command set.
When setting, the previous value for the attribute is replaced by the value being set.

DIMSE services using N-GET operations use this command set field to provide an attribute tag for each of the attributes applicable to the N-GET operation. Each of the tag numbers in the array provided are added to the Attribute Identifier List attribute.

member.exception: The message has been disposed.
The attribute was not found when getting this property.
The attribute has no values.
An invalid value was being set for this property.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCdimseMessage.Command
member.summary: Represents the DIMSE Command for this messages.
member.value: An ushort value representing this message's command.

remarks.para: This property gets the DIMSE Command associated with this message.

The value returned will be one of the command codes defined by class:
Composite Store Service Request and Reply: C_STORE_RQ, C_STORE_RSP
Composite Get Service Request, Reply and Cancel: C_GET_RQ, C_GET_RSP, C_CANCEL_GET_RQ
Composite Find Service Request, Reply and Cancel: C_FIND_RQ, C_FIND_RSP, C_CANCEL_FIND_RQ
Composite Move Service Request, Reply and Cancel: C_MOVE_RQ, C_MOVE_RSP, C_CANCEL_MOVE_RQ
Verification Service Request and Reply: C_ECHO_RQ, C_ECHO_RSP

Normalized Get Service Request and Reply: N_GET_RQ, N_GET_RSP

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdirRecord.addChildRecord(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a lower level directory record to the current record.
member.param: The name of the record item to be created. See RecordName property for possible values.
member.returns: An MCdirRecord object representing the newly added child record.
member.remarks: The name provided is used to access configuration information which describes the attributes of the new directory record. If such configuration information is not available, an empty item object is created, and a warning message is logged.
member.exception: The argument was null.
An error with the Message Information configuration file. See the log file for more details.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
The directory record type specified is an invalid lower level type for the current directory record.
The Merge DICOM toolkit found a corrupted record ID in a directory record offset attribute while trying to traverse the DICOMDIR.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdirRecord.delete
member.summary: Deletes this directory record and any entities it references.
member.exception: The Merge DICOM toolkit found a corrupted record ID in a directory record offset attribute while trying to traverse the DICOMDIR.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdirRecord.deleteChildren
member.summary: Deletes all lower level directory records.
member.exception: The Merge DICOM toolkit found a corrupted record ID in a directory record offset attribute while trying to traverse the DICOMDIR.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdirRecord.getReferencedRecordCount
member.summary: Returns a count of the number of items contained "below" this record.
member.returns: An integer representing the number of sub-items.
member.remarks: The count returned is computed during this function call. Because this count is generated on the fly, there is a performance penalty associated with this call. During this call, each record referenced by this record is traversed, and the total number of items is generated.
member.exception: An error with the Message Information configuration file. See the log file for more details.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
The Merge DICOM toolkit found a corrupted record ID in a directory record offset attribute while trying to traverse the DICOMDIR.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdirRecord.getChildCount
member.summary: Returns the number of child records of the current record.
member.returns: An integer representing the number of child records.
member.remarks: The count returned is maintained internally whenever records are added or deleted from a DICOMDIR. Because this count is maintained internally, there is no performance penalty associated with this function call.
member.exception: An error with the Message Information configuration file. See the log file for more details.
A problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
The Merge DICOM toolkit found a corrupted record ID in a directory record offset attribute while trying to traverse the DICOMDIR.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdirRecord.getFirstChild
member.summary: Gets the first lower level record.
member.returns: An MCdirRecord representing the lower level record or null if the current record does not have child records.
member.exception: The Merge DICOM toolkit found a corrupted record ID in a directory record offset attribute while trying to traverse the DICOMDIR.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCdirRecord.getNextChild
member.summary: Gets the next lower level directory record.
member.returns: An MCdirRecord representing the next lower level record or null if the current record does not have more lower level records.
member.exception: The Merge DICOM toolkit found a corrupted record ID in a directory record offset attribute while trying to traverse the DICOMDIR.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCfile
member.summary: Represents a DICOM Media Storage file.

remarks.para: Each instance of this class contains an object and an object.
An may be constructed with a pre-populated data set or with an empty data set.

Please refer to the following DICOM Standard documents for detailed information about DICOM media storage:
Part 10: Media Storage and File Format for Media Interchange (PS 3.10)
Part 11: Media Storage Application Profiles (PS 3.11)
Part 12: Media Formats and Physical Media for Media Interchange (PS 3.12)

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCfile.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an "empty" instance of this class with a specified file name.

remarks.para: The created MCfile object is not associated with any particular DICOM service or command and it will have an empty object.

This form of the constructor is used if the service and command are not yet known, or if there is no need to validate that values will be set only for attributes assigned to a given service/command pair. If the validate method is to be called, the method must be called first to associate this file object with a given DICOM service and command.

An error occurred involving the message info file. The exact error is logged in the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.

member.summary: Creates an MCfile containing the data set for the specified service/command.
member.param: A valid service command.

remarks.para: The file defaults to a file named "UNSPECIFIED".

Composite Store Service Request and Reply: C_STORE_RQ, C_STORE_RSP
Composite Get Service Request, Reply and Cancel: C_GET_RQ, C_GET_RSP, C_CANCEL_GET_RQ
Composite Find Service Request, Reply and Cancel: C_FIND_RQ, C_FIND_RSP, C_CANCEL_FIND_RQ
Composite Move Service Request, Reply and Cancel: C_MOVE_RQ, C_MOVE_RSP, C_CANCEL_MOVE_RQ
Verification Service Request and Reply: C_ECHO_RQ, C_ECHO_RSP
Normalized Report Service Request and Reply: N_EVENT_REPORT_RQ, N_EVENT_REPORT_RSP
Normalized Get Service Request and Reply: N_GET_RQ, N_GET_RSP
Normalized Set Service Request and Reply: N_SET_RQ, N_SET_RSP
Normalized Action Service Request and Reply: N_ACTION_RQ, N_ACTION_RSP
Normalized Create Service Request and Reply: N_CREATE_RQ, N_CREATE_RSP
Normalized Delete Service Request and Reply: N_DELETE_RQ, N_DELETE_RSP

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo
member.summary: Represents a Failed SOP Sequence item.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo.PROCESSING_FAILURE
member.summary: Processing failure reason code. A general failure in processing the operation was encountered.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo.NO_SUCH_OBJECT
member.summary: No such object instance reason code. One or more of the elements in the Referenced SOP Instance Sequence was not available.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo.RESOURCE_LIMITATION
member.summary: Resoure limitation reason code. The SCP does not currently have enough resources to store the requested SOP instances.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo.REF_SOP_CLASS_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: Referenced SOP Class not supported reason code. Storage Commitment has been requested for a SOP instance with a SOP Class that is not supported by the SCP.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo.CLASS_INSTANCE_CONFLICT
member.summary: Class/Instance conflict reason code. The SOP Class of an element in the Referenced SOP Instance Sequence did not correspond to the SOP class registered for the SOP Instance at the SCP.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo.DUPLICATE_TRANSACTION_UID
member.summary: Duplicate transaction UID reason code. The Transaction UID of a Storage Commitment Request is already in use.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo.refSopClassUid
member.summary: The unique identifier of the failed SOP Class.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo.refSopInstanceUid
member.summary: The unique identifier of the failed SOP Instance.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCfailedSopInfo.failureReason

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCmediaStorageService.readFile(Mergecom.MCfile,Mergecom.MCdataSource)
member.summary: Requests that the contents of a DICOM Part 10 file be converted and placed into the provided .

remarks.para: If the file contains any attributes with a value representation of SQ (i.e. the file contains one or more sequence of items), an object is automatically opened for each item in the file. The object is used as the value for each item in the sequence attribute.

This method reads in the DICOM File Meta Information attributes in Explicit VR Little Endian transfer syntax. The remainder of the file is read in with the transfer syntax specified in the attribute (0002,0010).

member.param: A not null reference.
A not null reference.
member.exception:
May be caused by one of the following:
an invalid DICOM file prefix was found.
a tag was found in the stream that was not in ascending order.
an invalid DICOM tag was detected in the stream.
callback stopped without passing the entire value for an attribute.
too many private blocks were encountered in the stream.
An argument was invalid.
The file has been disposed.
An exception occurred while reading the source. Check the inner exception for details.
An invalid transfer syntax code was found within the file's DICOM File Meta Information.
An unexpected, potentially serious, problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
Uneven data size returned by the source.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCmediaStorageService.readFileUpToTag(Mergecom.MCfile,System.UInt32,Mergecom.MCdataSource,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Requests that the contents of a DICOM file be converted and placed into the provided .
member.param: A not null reference.
The tag identifying the last attribute to process.
A not null reference.

Return argument set to the value of the tag after the last one that was parsed when reading the message. If the message has been parsed in its entirety, then the tag returned will be the 'virtual next', i.e. the last tag parsed plus 1. If the callback stopped without parsing the entire value for an attribute, the value returned will be zero. Which also means with certainty that the target tag is not present in the parsed data.
member.returns:
The number of source bytes processed, i.e. the file offset to the attribute immediately following .
If is zero, then the entire file is read and the return value is also zero.
member.exception:
May be caused by one of the following:
an invalid DICOM file prefix was found.
a tag was found in the stream that was not in ascending order.
an invalid DICOM tag was detected in the stream.
too many private blocks were encountered in the stream.
An argument was invalid.
The file has been disposed.
An exception occurred while reading the source. Check the inner exception for details.
An invalid transfer syntax code was found within the file's DICOM File Meta Information.
An unexpected, potentially serious, problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
Uneven data size returned by the source.

remarks.para: This method processes attributes only up to the attribute specified by .

If the file contains any attributes with a value representation of SQ (i.e. the file contains one or more sequence of items), an object is automatically opened for each item in the file. The object is used as the value for each item in the sequence attribute.

This method reads in the DICOM File Meta Information attributes in Explicit VR Little Endian transfer syntax. The remainder of the file is read in with the transfer syntax specified in the attribute (0002,0010).

The overloaded method returns an when the callback has stopped without returning the entire value for an attribute. In certain (repetitive) scenarios the raising and handling of the exception is costly. This method forgoes raising the exception in favour of returning zero in the argument.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCmediaStorageService.writeFile(Mergecom.MCfile,System.Int32,Mergecom.MCdataSink)
member.summary: Writes the contents of an into a DICOM Part 10 standard file format. The file is passed in blocks to .

remarks.para: This method will automatically fill in two group 2 attributes within the file meta information - if they are not set. This is the Implementation Class UID (0002,0012) and the Implementation Version Name (0002,0013). These values are set according to the configuration options for these values.

Note: If is an MCdir instance a warning will be logged if the file's transfer syntax is not Explicit Little Endian according to the DICOM standard. If the file's transfer syntax is Deflated Little Endian or is encapsulated an will be thrown.

member.param: A not null object identifying the file to be streamed.
The file will be padded a multiple of this number of bytes.
A not null object that will be used to store the stream data.
member.exception: An argument was invalid.
The file has been disposed.
An unexpected, potentially serious, problem was detected in the operating environment. A message describing the error has been written to the Merge DICOM toolkit log file.
The transfer syntax is improperly specified or is not specified in the DICOM File Meta Information attributes.
An exception occurred while writing data to the destination. Check the inner exception for details.
One of the attributes had an invalid value.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCpersonName
member.summary: Represents a DICOM person name value.

remarks.para: For the purpose of writing names in ideographic characters and in phonetic characters, up to 3 groups of components may be used. The delimiter for component groups shall be the equals character "=".

The three component groups of components in their order of occurrence are: a single-byte character representation, an ideographic representation, and a phonetic representation. Any component group may be absent, including the first component group. In this case, the person name may start with one or more "=" delimiters. Delimiters are required for interior null component groups. Trailing null component groups and their delimiters may be omitted.
Each of the component groups may contain representations of the following name components:

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCpersonName.#ctor(Mergecom.MCpnComponentGroup,Mergecom.MCpnComponentGroup,Mergecom.MCpnComponentGroup)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class based on the specified component groups.
member.param: The single byte character representation of the person name, or null if it is not known.
The ideographic representation of the person name, or null if it is not known.
The phonetic representation of the name, or null if it is not known.
member.remarks: This form of the constructor constructs a DICOM person name using 1 to 3 different representations of the name.

The middle name.

The name suffix.
member.remarks: Any of the five arguments may be empty or null.
member.exception: caret(^) or equals(=) characters in one of the arguments.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCpnComponentGroup
member.summary: Represents a DICOM person name component group.

remarks.para:
A DICOM person name component group contains optional values for five name components:
family name complex
given name complex
middle name
name prefix
name suffix

A DICOM person name value (VR=PN) may consist of up to three different person name component groups. Each is optional and appear in this order:
A character representation of the component group
An ideographic representation of the component group
A phonetic representation of the component group

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class using a string containing the person name.
member.param: A String containing the name components, each separated by the caret (^) character as specified in the DICOM standard. It may be null, indicating an empty component group.
member.exception: The argument contains more than four caret characters or it contains an equals character.

The name suffix.

member.exception: caret(^) or equals(=) characters in one of the arguments.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCproposedContextList
member.summary: Represents a list of presentation contexts that are being proposed for association negotiation.
member.remarks: When an association is being established, the association acceptor and association requester each offer a list of contexts that the application entity is willing to support. Each context is a DICOM service and one or more transfer syntaxes that can be used.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCproposedContextList.#ctor(System.String,Mergecom.MCproposedContext[],System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

remarks.para: MCproposedContextList objects are used to identify those services a DICOM association partner is willing to perform. The services can be used for asynchronous DICOM communications.
The new object will encapsulate the array of objects. An is thrown if an MCproposedContextList object has already been created with the specified name. The name must consist of 1 to 129 characters.

Note that proposed context lists may be defined in a [<service_list_name>] section of the app configuration file. If matches the <service_list_name> defined in the app file, MCalreadyExistsException will be thrown. You can retrieve such a pre-defined proposed context list by using the method.

member.param: The name identifying this list.
An array of objects.
The maximum number of asynchronous operations invoked.
The maximum number of asynchronous operations performed.
member.exception: A proposed context list has already been registered with a name of .

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCqueryRetrieveService
member.summary: Represents a DICOM Query Retrieve Service class.

remarks.para: The Query/Retrieve Service Class defines an application-level class-of-service which facilitates the simple management of composite object instances. The types of queries which are allowed are not complex. This Service Class is not intended to provide a comprehensive generalized database query mechanism such as SQL. Instead, the Query/Retrieve Service Class is focused towards basic composite object instance information queries using a small set of common Key Attributes.

In addition, the Query/Retrieve Service Class provides the ability to retrieve/transfer a well-identified set of composite object instances. The retrieve/transfer capability allows a DICOM Application Entity(AE) to retrieve composite object instances from a remote DICOM AE or request the remote DICOM AE to initiate a transfer of composite object instances to another DICOM AE.
Refer to Part 4 of the DICOM standard for more detailed information.

This class provides methods to support the following standard SOP Classes:
Patient Root Query/Retrieve Information Model - FIND
Patient Root Query/Retrieve Information Model - MOVE
Patient Root Query/Retrieve Information Model - GET
Study Root Query/Retrieve Information Model - FIND
Study Root Query/Retrieve Information Model - MOVE
Study Root Query/Retrieve Information Model - GET
Patient/Study Only Query/Retrieve Information Model - FIND
Patient/Study Only Query/Retrieve Information Model - MOVE
Patient/Study Only Query/Retrieve Information Model - GET

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCqueryRetrieveService.sendCompletedWithFailuresResponse(Mergecom.MCdimseMessage,Mergecom.MCdataSet,System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary:
Sends a Response message with a status of
MCdimseService.C_MOVE_WARNING_ONE_OR_MORE_FAILURES.

remarks.para: This method sends a response message indicating that the C-GET or C-MOVE operation contained in requestMsg completed, but one or more failures were encountered.

Each of the last three arguments are optional, marked by a value of . If the value is not , completedSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1021), failedSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1022), and warningSubOperations will be encoded in attribute (0000,1023).

This form of the call must be used when the C-STORE sub-operation for one or more SOP instances failed. In that case, the identifier must contain the Failed SOP Instance UID List (0008,0048) attribute that specifies a list of UIDs of the C-STORE sub-operation SOP Instances for which the C-GET or C-MOVE operation has failed. If there were no sub-operation failures, there is no need for an identifier data set and the other form of the method can be used.
The status attribute (0000,0900) will be set to 0xB000 (completed with failures).

member.param: The request message being responded to.
Contains Failed SOP Instance UID List.
Completed sub-operation count.
Failed sub-operation count.
Warning sub-operation count.
member.exception: This method was called at an inappropriate time. This would be thrown, for example, if this method were called when there is no response message pending for .
The association was aborted. No further calls may be made for the association.
The service associated with is not one that was negotiated for the association, or it was never set.
The command associated with the message was invalid or the message argument was null.

The status attribute (0000,0900) will be set to 0xB000 (completed with failures).

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCremoteApplication
member.summary: Contains information about a remote DICOM application.

remarks.para: Specifically the class contains the remote application's Application Entitiy Title, its , and the default proposed context list that will be used when negotiating an association with the remote application.
Instances can be created using the constructor or with the method.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCremoteApplication.#ctor(System.String,System.Net.IPEndPoint,Mergecom.MCproposedContextList)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class that describes the properties of a remote DICOM Application Entity.
member.param: The DICOM Application Entity Title by which the remote application is known.
An containing the network address of the remote application.
The list of services that will be negotiated with the remote application.
member.remarks: The Merge DICOM toolkit accepts IPv4, IPv6 or both address types depending on the IP_TYPE configuration option specified in mergecom.pro.
member.exception: One of the arguments had an illegal value.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCremoteApplication.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Mergecom.MCproposedContextList)

The hostname of the remote application.
The port address of the remote application.
The list of services that will be negotiated with the remote application.
member.remarks: If the value of the IP_TYPE configuration option is 'IPV4' or 'IPV6 the toolkit will use only IPv4 or IPv6 addresses respectively. If the value is 'AVAILABLE' the toolkit will use an IPv6 address if available and an IPv4 address if not.
member.exception: One of the arguments had an illegal value.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCrequester
member.summary: Defines the methods required for handling a newly created association as a requester.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCrequester.start(Mergecom.MCassociation)
member.summary: Called by the toolkit to process the association communication for a requester.
member.param: The opened association object.

remarks.para: This method is called in a separate thread for each concurrent association. Threads are recycled by the toolkit as associations are released or aborted.
If this method throws an exception a message will be logged and the association will end.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCresultContext
member.summary: Contains information about a DICOM service that has been rejected or accepted by the remote DICOM application.

member.summary: Retrieves negotiation information by decoding the provided .
member.param: An instance.
member.returns: true if the decoding succeded.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCresultContext.PresentationContextID
member.summary: Gets the Presentation Context ID of this negotiated context.
member.value: The Presentation Context ID.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCresultContext.ResultCode
member.summary: Gets the 1-byte Code returned during negotiation for this context.
member.value: A byte containing the result code.
member.remarks:
The following result codes are defined:
0 - acceptance
1 - user-rejection
2 - no-reason (provider rejection)
3 - abstract-syntax-not-supported (provider rejection)
4 - transfer-syntax-not-supported (provider rejection)

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCresultContext.RoleNegotiated
member.value: 'U' if SCU, 'P' if SCP or 'B' if both.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCresultContext.ServiceName
member.summary: Gets the service name for this result context.
member.value: Name of the service associated with this context.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCresultContext.TransferSyntax
member.summary: Gets the transfer syntax associated with this result context.
member.value: The accepted .

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCresultContext.NegotiationInfo
member.summary: Gets the extended negotiation info associated with this result context.
member.value: The accepted .

member.summary: Determines if this object equals another object.
member.param: The object to compare to this object
member.returns: true if both objects refer to the same DICOM SOP Class
member.remarks: The other object is considered equal to this object if it is a non-null MCsopClass instance and its library-assigned id is the same as that assigned to this object.

member.summary: Returns a hash code equal to this object's internal numeric ID.
member.returns: A code usable for hash tables.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCsopClass.getSopClassByUid(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the MCsopClass object that encapsulates the DICOM service identified by a specific UID.

remarks.para: The library maintains a collection of MCsopClass objects. As objects are retrieved from the C tool kit, they are maintained in the collection so subsequent calls to this method will return the same instance for the same UID.
If the method cannot find an instance matching the provided UID, an exception is thrown.

member.param: The not null DICOM unique identifier assigned to the requested SOP Class.
member.returns: A not null MCsopClass object.
member.exception: The argument is not a valid DICOM UID string.
No SOP class is defined for the specified UID.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCsopClass.getSopClassByName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the MCsopClass object which encapsulates the DICOM service identified by the specified name.

remarks.para: Each DICOM service supported by Merge DICOM Toolkit is identified by its DICOM unique identifier (the UID) and by a unique name (serviceName).

The library maintains a collection of MCsopClass objects. As objects are retrieved from the C tool kit, they are maintained in the collection so subsequent calls to this method will return the same instance for the same name.
If the method cannot find the requested MCsopClass instance, an exception is thrown.

member.param: The name of a DICOM service.
member.returns: A not null MCsopClass object.
member.exception: The argument is not a valid service name.
No SOP class is defined with the specified name.

member.summary: The array which reflects which DICOM commands are supported by this service.

member.remarks: defines values which can be used to identify index values into the bit array for each DICOM command.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCstorageNegotiation
member.summary: Contains Storage Service Class Extended Negotiation data.
member.remarks: The Storage Service Class can negotiate the degree of Element Coercion and the SCP support level.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCstorageNegotiation.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class that specifies an SCP level of 3 and a coercion level 2.
member.remarks: See and properties for defined values of the SCP level and coercion.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCstorageNegotiation.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class for the provided SCP level and coercion.
member.param: DICOM specified coercion value (0, 1 or 2).
DICOM specified Level of Support value (0, 1, 2 or 3).
member.exception: The value of one of the parameters was invalid

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCstorageNegotiation.decode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Retrieves Storage Service support data from DICOM extended negotiation info buffer.
member.param: A six byte buffer as received during the negotiation.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCstorageNegotiation.toByteArray
member.summary: Converts Storage Service negotiation info to buffer as defined by DICOM.
member.returns: A six byte buffer containing the extended negotiation information.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCstorageNegotiation.ElementCoercion
member.value: An integer representing the element coercion level.

remarks.para: This property sets or gets the element coercion level for a Storage Service Class.

coercion levels are defined by the DICOM standard:
0: While performing the SCP role, the application does not coerce any Data Element.
1: While performing the SCP role, the application may coerce Data Elements.
2: N/A - The application is SCU only.

member.exception: The value for the coercion is an invalid value.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCstorageNegotiation.SCPsupportLevel
member.value: An integer representing the SCP support level.

remarks.para: Sets or gets the SCP support level for a Storage Service Class as defined by DICOM:

list.item: 0: level 0 SCP
1: level 1 SCP
2: level 2 SCP
3: N/A SCU only

member.exception: The value for the SCP support level is an invalid value.

If the is not null, the SCP will use this value to uniquely identify the General Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance it creates. If null, the SCP will assign an instance UID and return it in the response message as the affected SOP Instance Uid.

The service associated with the data set provided will be set to the "G_P_SCHEDULED_PROCEDURE_STEP" service or the service identified by the parameter. The data set's command will be set to N_ACTION_RQ.

member.param: Possibly null affected SOP Class. If null, "G_P_SCHEDULED_PROCEDURE_STEP" is used.
Not null UID of the General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step SOP Instance for which it wants to modify Action Information,
Not null object containing the set of attributes and their values which are to be used by the SCP to modify the SOP instance.
If true the Type 1 and Type 2 attributes will be checked to ensure that they are set properly and an will be thrown if they are not.
member.returns: The object that was used to send the DIMSE request.
member.exception: This method was called at an inappropriate time. This would be thrown, for example, if this method were called by an association acceptor before calling the accept method of the object associated with this service.
The service associated with message is not one that was negotiated for the association, or it was never set.
The association was aborted. No further calls may be made for the association.
Sending this request message will cause the maximum operations negotiated to be exceeded.
One of the arguments was invalid.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCstudyManagementService.sendStudyVerifiedNotification(Mergecom.MCsopClass,System.String,Mergecom.Gen.MCdetachedStudyManagementEventReport,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends an N-EVENT-REPORT DIMSE message with an Event Type ID of 6 to an SCU using a Detached Study Management SOP Class.

remarks.para: If requested, the container is checked to insure all type 1 and type 2 attributes have been set.

The following fields are required:
Type 1: must be set and may not be null
StudyVerifiedDate
StudyVerifiedTime
ReferencedStudyComponents
ReferencedStudyComponents->ReferencedSOPClassUID
ReferencedStudyComponents->ReferencedSOPInstanceUID
This event is used to notify the SCU that a Study has been Verified.

member.param: The SOP Class affected by this notification. If null, "DETACHED_STUDY_MANAGEMENT" is used.
Non-null UID assigned to the affected Study Instance.

Non-null container containing the attribute values related to a Study Verified Event. It must have been constructed using a data set. The data set will have its service set per the parameter, and its command will be set to N_EVENT_REPORT_RQ.
If true the Type 1 and Type 2 attributes will be checked to ensure that that are set properly and will be thrown if they are not.
member.returns: The object that was used to send the DIMSE request.
member.exception: This method was called at an inappropriate time. This would be thrown, for example, if this method were called by an association acceptor before calling the accept method of the object associated with this service.
The service associated with message is not one that was negotiated for the association, or it was never set.
The association was aborted. No further calls may be made for the association.
An attribute required by the service was not supplied in the message.
Sending this request message will cause the maximum operations negotiated to be exceeded.
One of the arguments was invalid.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCtag
member.summary: Represents a DICOM data element identifier normally referred to as a "tag".

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.isPrivate(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Determines if a tag is private element.
member.param: The tag value.
member.remarks: A tag is considered private element if its group number is odd and its element number is not in the range [0x0010,0x00FF]. Odd numbered groups 1, 3, 5, 7 and 0xFFFF, and element numbers in the range [0x0001,0x000F] or [0x0100,0x0FFF] are DICOM non-compliant (will generate warning message). Note: element 0 (group length - retired) isn't treated as private data element and will return false.
member.returns: true if the argument represents a private element; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.isPrivateCode(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Determines if a tag is a private creator element tag.
member.param: The tag value.
member.remarks: A tag is considered private creator element tag if its group number is odd and it has element numbers between 0x0010 and 0x00FF inclusively. Odd numbered groups 1, 3, 5, 7 and 0xFFFF will generate a warning message since these are DICOM non-compliant.
member.returns: true if the argument represents a private creator element; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.param: The tag number.
member.exception: The tagNumber argument represents a private element.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Constructs a non-private DICOM tag from group and element numbers expressed as integers.
member.param: Most significant 2 bytes of the tag number.
Least significant 2 bytes of the tag number.
member.exception: The arguments represent a private element.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.#ctor(System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Constructs a private DICOM tag from creator code, group and element numbers expressed as integers.
member.param: Creator code string for the private group.
The private tag's group (an odd number).
The private tag's element number (0-255).
member.exception: One of the arguments was invalid.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a DICOM tag from creator code and a tag number.
member.param: The tag number.
DICOM code string for private group; null for a standard dicom tag.
member.exception: One of the arguments was invalid.
member.remarks: This constructor can be used to create a private creator code tag.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents this tag.
member.returns: A string representation of this DICOM tag.
member.remarks: The returned String contains the tag number as a hexadecimal number. If the tag is private, its private code is included.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code based on this tag's number and private code.
member.returns: A hash code value for this object.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether this tag is equal to another object.
member.remarks: The objects are declared equal if the other object is a non-null instance of MCtag and the tag numbers are equal and (if this is a private tag) both private codes are equal.
member.param: The object to compare to this object.
member.returns: true if both objects refer to the same DICOM tag.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtag.Compare(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares this object to another object.
member.param: The object to compare against this object.
member.returns: -1 if this object is less than , 1 if object is greater than and 0 if they are equal.

remarks.para: MCtag instances can be compared to each other or to unsigned integers (uint) representing DICOM tag numbers.

The order of two tags is given by the order of their tag numbers. For private tags that have the same group number but different private creator codes the order is based on the order of the private creator code strings.

member.exception: The type of the argument was invalid for comparison.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCtag.IsPrivateTag
member.summary: Determines whether this tag represents a private element.
member.remarks: A tag is considered private element if its group number is odd and its element number is not in the range [0x0010,0x00FF]. Odd numbered groups 1, 3, 5, 7 and 0xFFFF, and element numbers in the range [0x0001,0x000F] or [0x0100,0x0FFF] are DICOM non-compliant (will generate warning message). Note: element 0 (group length - retired) isn't treated as private data element and will return false.
member.returns: true if this is a private tag; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCtag.IsPrivateCode
member.summary: Determines whether this tag represents a private creator element.
member.remarks: A tag is considered private creator element tag if its group number is odd and it has element numbers between 0x0010 and 0x00FF inclusively. Odd numbered groups 1, 3, 5, 7 and 0xFFFF will generate a warning message since these are DICOM non-compliant.
member.returns: true if this is a private creator element tag; otherwise false.

remarks.para: Instances of this class are created by the library for each known transfer syntax. These instances can be accessed either by static properties or by the getSyntaxByUid static method.
Each transfer syntax is identified by a unique DICOM UID. The transfer syntax also has a name by which it is widely known.

A transfer syntax defines the use of either Explicit Value Representation or Implicit Value Representation of values; and it uses either Big Endian or Little Endian encoding techniques. Also, a transfer syntax may represent a DICOM encapsulated syntax.

member.returns: The requested MCtransferSyntax object or null if the UID does not match any known tranfer syntax.
member.exception: The uid parameter was null.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCtransferSyntaxList
member.summary: Represents a list of transfer syntaxes used in association negotiation.
member.remarks: When an association is being established, the association acceptor and association requester each offer a list of contexts that the application entity is willing to support. Each context is a DICOM service and one or more transfer syntaxes that can be used. The transfer syntax list is encapsulated in objects of this class.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtransferSyntaxList.#ctor(System.String,Mergecom.MCtransferSyntax[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class using a name and a list of transfer syntaxes.

remarks.para: objects are used to identify the transfer syntaxes supported for the services a DICOM association partner is willing to perform.
The object will encapsulate the specified array of MCtransferSyntax objects. An is thrown if an object has already been created with the name . The
The array of syntaxes specified in the syntaxes parameter is copied so later it may be changed without affecting the created MCtransferSyntaxList object.

Note that transfer syntax lists may be defined in a [<syntax_list_name >] section of the app configuration file. If matches a <syntax_list_name> defined in the app file, an will be thrown. You can retrieve such a pre-defined proposed context list by using the method.

member.param: A name which uniquely identifies this transfer syntax list to the Merge DICOM toolkit. It must consist of 1 to 33 characters.
A non null reference to an array of MCtransferSyntax objects.
member.exception: One of the arguments had an invalid value. Check the exception message for details.
A transfer syntax list has already been registered with this name.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCtransferSyntaxList.getObject(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the transfer syntax list with the specified name.
member.remarks: The returned object was previously created by calling constructor or it is automatically created from transfer syntax lists configured in the app configuration file.
member.param: The name identifying the requested list.
member.returns: An object, or null if there is no syntax list with the specified name.
member.exception: The argument was null.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCvalidationError
member.remarks:
Validation error objects are created by the library whenever a validation method returns false. The following calls can result in validation errors:
MCabstractMessage.validate()
MCabstractMessage.validateAttribute()
MCdataSet.validate()
MCdataSet.validateAttribute()

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvalidationError.AttributeSet
member.summary: The object that contained the invalid attribute value.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvalidationError.ErrorDescription
member.summary: Description of the validation error encountered.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvalidationError.Tag
member.summary: The object that identifies the invalid attribute.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvalidationError.ValueNumber
member.summary: Indicates which of the attribute's values was involved with the validation error.
member.remarks: A value of 1 means the first value is invalid, 2 means the second value and so on. Zero means the validation error was not caused by the value of the attribute.

remarks.para: The value of this field represents the validation violation and it can have one of the following values:
Information statuses:

list.item: MCexception.NO_CONDITION_FUNCTION: The attribute's DICOM type is "1C" or "2C" and no function was available to check the condition. A user-defined condition function was not correctly linked with the program.
MCexception.UNABLE_TO_CHECK_CONDITION: Not enough information is available to check whether or not a DICOM type "1C" or "2C" attribute is required.

remarks.para: Warnings:

list.item: MCexception.NOT_ONE_OF_DEFINED_TERMS: A value setfor this attribute is not one of the valid defined terms assigned to this attribute.
MCexception.NON_SERVICE_ATTRIBUTE: The attribute is not one of those defined for the message's service. Note that private attributes will not cause this violation

remarks.para: Errors:

list.item: MCexception.INVALID_VR_CODE: The attribute's value representation is unknown.
MCexception.REQUIRED_ATTRIBUTE_MISSING: An attribute which is required for the message service has been deleted from the message object.
MCexception.REQUIRED_VALUE_MISSING: The attribute is required to have a value but it is empty.
MCexception.VALUE_MAY_NOT_BE_NULL: The attribute is DICOM type "1" or type "1C" and it has been encoded with a NULL value.
MCexception.VALUE_NOT_ALLOWED: This DICOM type "1C" or type "2C" attribute may not have a value under current conditions.
MCexception.TOO_FEW_VALUES: The attribute is required to have more values set.
MCexception.TOO_MANY_VALUES: The attribute has more values set than are allowed.
MCexception.INVALID_ITEM_ID: This sequence of items (SQ) attribute has an invalid value assigned to it.
MCexception.NOT_ONE_OF_ENUMERATED_VALUES: A value set for this attribute is not one of the valid enumerated values assigned to this attribute.
MCexception.INVALID_VALUE_FOR_VR: A value for this attribute does not conform to the requirements of its value representation.
MCexception.INVALID_CHARS_IN_VALUE: A value for this attribute does not contain valid characters for its value representation.

member.name: M:Mergecom.MCvalidationError.ToString
member.summary: Returns a multi-line string describing the validation error.
member.returns: A string object describing the validation error.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCverificationService

member.remarks: This class provides methods to send request and response messages, enforcing the requirements of this service class. In general it relieves the user of the responsibility to update command set attributes.

member.name: T:Mergecom.MCvr
member.summary: This class represents a DICOM Value Representation.
member.remarks: The library creates instances of this class for every known Value Representation. These instances can be accessed through static readonly fileds.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrAE
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Application Entity

item.description: A string of characters with leading and trailing spaces (20H) being non-significant. The value made of 16 spaces, meaning "no application name specified", shall not be used.
Default Character Repertoire excluding control characters LF, FF, CR and ESC.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrAS
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Age String.

description.para: A string of characters with one of the following formats -- nnnD, nnnW, nnnM, nnnY; where nnn shall contain the number of days for D, weeks for W, months for M, or years for Y.
Example: "018M" would represent an age of 18 months.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrAT
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Attribute Tag.

description.para: Ordered pair of 16-bit unsigned integers that is the value of a Data Element Tag.
Example:
A Data Element Tag of (0018,00FF) would be encoded as a series of 4 bytes in a Little-Endian Transfer Syntax as 18H,00H,FFH,00H and in a Big-Endian Transfer Syntax as 00H,18H,00H,FFH.

Note: The encoding of an AT value is exactly the same as the encoding of a Data Element Tag. That is it consists of two 2-byte integers with the high-order value specifying the tag group and the low-order value specifying the tag element.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrCS
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Code String.

item.description: A string of characters with leading or trailing spaces (20H) being non-significant.
Uppercase characters, '0'-'9', the SPACE character, and underscore '_', of the Default Character Repertoire

description.para: A string of characters of the format yyyymmdd; where yyyy shall contain year, mm shall contain the month, and dd shall contain the day. This conforms to the ANSI HISPP MSDS Date common data type.
Example:
"19930822" would represent August 22, 1993.
Notes:
1. For reasons of backward compatibility with versions of this standard prior to V3.0, it is recommended that implementations also support a string of characters of the format yyyy.mm.dd for this VR.
2. See also DT VR.
'0'-'9' of Default Character Repertoire
Note: For reasons specified in the previous column, implementations may wish to support the '.' character as well.
8 bytes fixed
Note: For reasons specified in the previous columns, implementations may also wish to support a 10 byte fixed length as well.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrDS
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Decimal String.

item.description: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number. A fixed point number shall contain only the characters '0'-'9' with an optional leading '+' or '-' and an optional '.' to mark the decimal point. A floating point number shall be conveyed as defined in ANSI X3.9, with an 'E' or 'e' to indicate the start of the exponent. Decimal Strings may be padded with leading or trailing spaces. Embedded spaces are not allowed.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrDT
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Date Time.

description.para: The Date Time common data type. Indicates a concatenated date-time ASCII string in the format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.FFFFFFZZZZ

The components of this string, from left to right, are YYYY = Year, MM = Month, DD = Day, HH = Hour, MM = Minute, SS = Second, FFFFFF = Fractional Second, Z = '+' or '-', and ZZZ = Hours and Minutes of offset.
ZZZZ is an optional suffix for plus/minus offset from Coordinated Universal Time.

A component that is omitted from the string is termed a null component. Trailing null components of Date Time are ignored. Non-trailing null components are prohibited, given that the optional suffix is not considered as a component.

Note: For reasons of backward compatibility with versions of this standard prior to V3.0, many existing DICOM Data Elements use the separate DA and TM VRs. Standard and Private Data Elements defined in the future should use DT, when appropriate, to be more compliant with ANSI HISPP MSDS.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrFD
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Floating Point Double.

item.description: Double precision binary floating point number represented in IEEE 754:1985 64-bit Floating Point Number Format.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrFL
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Floating Point Single.

item.description: Single precision binary floating point number represented in IEEE 754:1985 32-bit Floating Point Number Format.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrIS
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Integer String.

description.para: A string of characters representing an Integer in base-10 (decimal), shall contain only the characters 0 - 9, with an optional leading "+" or "-". It may be padded with leading and/or trailing spaces. Embedded spaces are not allowed.
The integer, n, represented shall be in the range:

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrLO
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Long String.

item.description: A character string that may be padded with leading and/or trailing spaces. The character code 5CH (the BACKSLASH '\' in ISO-IR 6) shall not be present, as it is used as the delimiter between values in multiple valued data elements. The string shall not have Control Characters except for ESC.
Default Character Repertoire and/or as defined by (0008,0005).
64 chars maximum (Note that this is the number of characters, not the number of bytes)

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrLT
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Long Text.

item.description: A character string that may contain one or more paragraphs. It may contain the Graphic Character set and the Control Characters, CR, LF, FF, and ESC. It may be padded with trailing spaces, which may be ignored, but leading spaces are considered to be significant. Data Elements with this VR shall not be multi-valued and therefore character code 5CH (the BACKSLASH '\' in ISO-IR 6) may be used.
Default Character Repertoire and/or as defined by (0008,0005).
10240 chars maximum (Note that this is the number of characters, not the number of bytes)

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrOB
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Other Byte.

item.description: A stream of bytes where the encoding of the contents is specified by the negotiated Transfer Syntax. OB is a VR which is insensitive to Little/Big Endian byte ordering. The string of bytes shall be padded with a single trailing NULL byte value (00H) when necessary to achieve even length.
As Defined by DICOM Transfer Syntax rules

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrOD
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Other Double.
member.remarks:
This Value Representation was proposed for the standard but not accepted. It is supported for backward compatibility for users that may have implemented it.
Definition
A stream of 64-bit IEEE 754:1985 floating point words. OD is a VR which requires byte swapping within each 64-bit word when changing between Little Endian and Big Endian byte ordering.
Character Repertoire not applicable
Length of Value 2 32 - 8 maximum

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrOF
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Other Float.

item.description: A stream of 32-bit IEEE 754:1985 floating point words. OF is a VR which requires byte swapping within each 32-bit word when changing between Little Endian and Big Endian byte ordering.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrOL
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Other Long.

item.description: A stream of 32-bit words where the encoding of the contents is specified by the negotiated Transfer Syntax. OL is a VR that requires byte swapping within each word when changing between Little Endian and Big Endian byte ordering.
As Defined by DICOM Transfer Syntax rules

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrOV
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Other 64-bit Very Long.

item.description: A stream of 64-bit words where the encoding of the contents is specified by the negotiated Transfer Syntax. OV is a VR that requires byte swapping within each word when changing byte ordering.
As Defined by DICOM Transfer Syntax rules

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrOW
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Other Word.

item.description: A stream of 16-bit words where the encoding of the contents is specified by the negotiated Transfer Syntax. OW is a VR which requires byte swapping within each word when changing between Little Endian and Big Endian byte ordering.
As Defined by DICOM Transfer Syntax rules

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrPN
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Person Name.

description.para: A character string encoded using a 5 component convention. The character code 5CH (the BACKSLASH '\' in ISO-IR 6) shall not be present, as it is used as the delimiter between values in multiple valued data elements. The string may be padded with trailing spaces. The five components in their order of occurrence are: family name complex, given name complex, middle name, name prefix, name suffix. Any of the five components may be an empty string. The component delimiter shall be the caret '^' character (5EH).

Delimiters are required for interior null components. Trailing null components and their delimiters may be omitted. Multiple entries are permitted in each component and are encoded as natural text strings, in the format preferred by the named person. This conforms to the ANSI HISPP MSDS Person Name common data type.
This group of five components is referred to as a Person Name component group.

For the purpose of writing names in ideographic characters and in phonetic characters, up to 3 groups of components (see Annex H examples 1 and 2) may be used. The delimiter for component groups shall be the equals character '=' (3DH). The three component groups of components in their order of occurrence are: a single-byte character representation, an ideographic representation, and a phonetic representation.

Any component group may be absent, including the first component group. In this case, the person name may start with one or more '=' delimiters. Delimiters are required for interior null component groups. Trailing null component groups and their delimiters may be omitted.
Precise semantics are defined for each component group.

item.description: Default Character Repertoire and/or as defined by (0008,0005) excluding Control Characters LF, FF, and CR but allowing Control Character ESC.
64 chars maximum per component group (Note that this is the number of characters, not the number of bytes)

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrSH
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Short String.

item.description: A character string that may be padded with leading and/or trailing spaces. The character code 05CH (the BACKSLASH '\' in ISO-IR 6) shall not be present, as it is used as the delimiter between values for multiple data elements. The string shall not have Control Characters except ESC.
Default Character Repertoire and/or as defined by (0008,0005).
16 chars maximum (Note that this is the number of characters, not the number of bytes)

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrSL
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Signed Long.

description.para: Signed binary integer 32 bits long in 2's complement form.
Represents an integer, n, in the range:

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrSV
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Signed 64-bit Very Long.

description.para: Signed binary integer 64 bits long.
Represents an integer, n, in the range:

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrSQ
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Sequence of Items.

item.description: Value is a Sequence of zero or more Items

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrSS
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Signed Short.

description.para: Signed binary integer 16 bits long in 2's complement form.
Represents an integer, n, in the range:

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrST
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Short Text.

item.description: A character string that may contain one or more paragraphs. It may contain the Graphic Character set and the Control Characters, CR, LF, FF, and ESC. It may be padded with trailing spaces, which may be ignored, but leading spaces are considered to be significant. Data Elements with this VR shall not be multi-valued and therefore character code 5CH (the BACKSLASH '\' in ISO-IR 6) may be used.
Default Character Repertoire and/or as defined by (0008,0005).
1024 chars maximum (Note that this is the number of characters, not the number of bytes)

description.para: A string of characters of the format hhmmss.frac; where hh contains hours (range "00" - "23"), mm contains minutes (range "00" - "59"), ss contains seconds (range "00" - "59"), and frac contains a fractional part of a second as small as 1 millionth of a second (range "000000" - "999999"). A 24 hour clock is assumed. Midnight can be represented by only "0000" since "2400" would violate the hour range. The string may be padded with trailing spaces. Leading and embedded spaces are not allowed. One or more of the components mm, ss, or frac may be unspecified as long as every component to the right of an unspecified component is also unspecified. If frac is unspecified the preceding '.' may not be included. Frac shall be held to six decimal places or less to ensure its format conforms to the ANSI HISPP MSDS Time common data type.
Examples:
1. "070907.0705 " represents a time of 7 hours, 9 minutes and 7.0705 seconds.
2. "1010" represents a time of 10 hours, and 10 minutes.
3. "021 " is an invalid value.
Notes:

1. For reasons of backward compatibility with versions of this standard prior to V3.0, it is recommended that implementations also support a string of characters of the format hh:mm:ss.frac for this VR.
2. See also DT VR.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrUC
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Unlimited Characters

item.description: A character string that may be of unlimited length that may be padded with trailing spaces. The character code 5CH (the BACKSLASH "\"in ISO-IR 6) shall not be present, as it is used as the delimiter between values in multiple valued data elements. The string shall not have Control Characters except for ESC.
Default Character Repertoire and/or as defined by (0008,0005).

description.para: Note: limited only by the size of the maximum unsigned integer representable in a 32 bit Value Length field minus one, since FFFFFFFFH is reserved.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrUI
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Unique Identifier (UID).

item.description: A character string containing a UID that is used to uniquely identify a wide variety of items. The UID is a series of numeric components separated by the period '.' character. If a Value Field containing one or more UIDs is an odd number of bytes in length, the Value Field shall be padded with a single trailing NULL (00H) character to ensure that the Value Field is an even number of bytes in length. See Section 9 and Annex B for a complete specification and examples.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrUL
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Unsigned Long.

description.para: Unsigned binary integer 32 bits long.
Represents an integer n in the range: 0 <= n < 2^32.

item.description: A string of bytes where the encoding of the contents is unknown.
Any length valid for any of the other DICOM Value Representations

A string of characters that identifies a URI or a URL as defined in [RFC 3986]. Leading spaces are not allowed. Trailing spaces shall be ignored. Data Elements with this VR shall not be multi-valued.
Both absolute and relative URIs are permitted. If the URI is relative, then it is relative to the base URI of the object within which it is contained.
The Backslash (5CH) character is among those disallowed inURIs.

The subset of the Default Character Repertoire required for the URI as defined in IETF RFC3986 Section 2, plus the space (20H) character permitted only as trailing padding. Characters outside the permitted character setmust be "percent encoded"..

description.para: Note: limited only by the size of the maximum unsigned integer representable in a 32 bit Value Length field minus one, since FFFFFFFFH is reserved.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrUS
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Unsigned Short.

description.para: Unsigned binary integer 16 bits long.
Represents an integer n in the range: 0 <= n < 2^16.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrUT
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Unlimited Text.

item.description: A character string that may contain one or more paragraphs. It may contain the Graphic Character set and the Control Characters, CR, LF, FF, and ESC. It may be padded with trailing spaces, which may be ignored, but leading spaces are considered to be significant. Data Elements with this VR shall not be multi-valued and therefore character code 5CH (the BACKSLASH '\' in ISO-IR 6) may be used.
Default Character Repertoire and/or as defined by (0008,0005).

description.para: Note: limited only by the size of the maximum unsigned integer representable in a 32 bit value length field minus one, since FFFFFFFFH is reserved.

member.name: F:Mergecom.MCvr.vrUV
member.summary: DICOM Value Representation for Unsigned 64-bit Very Long.

description.para: Unsigned binary integer 64 bits long.
Represents an integer n in the range: 0 <= n < 2^64.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.MultiByteBinaryVR
member.summary: Determines whether this Value Representation is for binary value that is represented by more than one byte.
member.value: true if this Value Representation is for a binary value that is represented by more than one byte; otherwise false.
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: SS, US, AT, SL, UL, FL, FD, OW, OV, OL, OD, OF.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.MultiValuedBinaryVR
member.summary: Determines whether this Value Representation is for a binary value that can be used for Multi-Valued Data Elements.
member.value: true if this Value Representation is for a binary value that can be used for Multi-Valued Data Elements; otherwise false.
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: SS, US, AT, SL, UL, SV, UV, FL, FD.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.MultiValuedIntegerVR
member.summary: Determines whether this Value Representation is for a binary value that can be used for Multi-Valued Data Elements, and is an integer number (short or long).
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: SS, US, AT, SL, UL, SV, UV.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.MultiValuedTextVR
member.summary: Determines whether this Value Representation is for a text string value that can be used for Multi-Valued Data Elements.
member.value: true if this Value Representation is for a text string value that can be used for Multi-Valued Data Elements; otherwise false.
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: AE, AS, CS, DA, DS, DT, IS, LO, PN, SH, TM, UI, UC.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.MultiValuedVR
member.summary: Determines whether this Value Representation is for a value that can be used for Multi-Valued Data Elements only.
member.value: true if this Value Representation is for a value that can be used for Single Valued Data Elements only; otherwise false.
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: SQ, SS, US, AT, SL, UL, SV, UV, FL, FD, AE, AS, CS, DA, DS, DT, IS, LO, PN, SH, TM, UI, UC.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.SingleValuedBinaryVR
member.summary: Determines whether this Value Representation is for a binary string value that can be used for Single Valued Data Elements only.
member.value: true if this Value Representation is for a binary string value that can be used for Single Valued Data Elements only; otherwise false.
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: UN, OB, OW, OV, OL, OD, OF.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.SingleValuedTextVR
member.summary: Determines whether this Value Representation is for a text string value that can be used for Single Valued Data Elements only.
member.value: true if this Value Representation is for a text string value that can be used for Single Valued Data Elements only; otherwise false.
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: LT, ST, UT, UR.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.SingleValuedVR
member.summary: Determines whether this Value Representation is for a value that can be used for Single Valued Data Elements only.
member.value: true if this Value Representation is for a value that can be used for Single Valued Data Elements only; otherwise false.
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: UN, OB, OW, OV, OL, OD, OF, LT, ST, UT, UR.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.TextVR
member.summary: Determines whether the Value Representation is for a text value.
member.value: true if this Value Representation is for a value that can be used for text values; otherwise false.
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: AE, AS, CS, DA, DS, DT, IS, LO, PN, SH, TM, UI, UC, LT, ST, UT, UR.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.BulkDataUriVR
member.summary: Determines whether the Value Representation is for a BulkDataURI.
member.value: true if this Value Representation is for a value that can be used for BulkDataURI; otherwise false.
member.remarks: These VRs meet this requirement: FL, FD, IS, LT, OB, OV, OL, OD, OF, OW, SL, SS, ST, UL, SV, UV, UN, US, or UT

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.ValueType
member.summary: The .NET type for values of this VR.
member.value: The Type of values for this VR.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.MaxSize
member.summary: Gets the maximum size of a value of this VR.
member.value: The maximum size of a value of this VR or Int32.MaxValue if the size is unlimited.
member.remarks: For VR's that are characterset specific the size is given in characters for all other VR's the size is in bytes.

member.name: P:Mergecom.MCvr.Name
member.summary: The DICOM 2-character name by which this VR is known.

member.param: MCassociation

member.name: M:Mergecom.Util.Utils.ObjectToBytes(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts an object to a byte array
member.param: An object to convert

member.name: M:Mergecom.Util.Utils.FindHashAlgorithmTypes
member.summary: Find the hash algorithms available on the platform for DICOM digital signature
member.returns: A list of the available hash algorithms
